text: Wow, that's all I have to say about this place. Came for lunch and everything was on point.  From my bloody Mary to the fried octopus (btw best I have ever had). The place is relaxed and great atmosphere. Will def be coming back very soon to try more dishes. So fresh and flavorful. :)
The food here is amazing!!  The decor is super nice as well.  Will definitely return as often as possible.

Great meal and great service. Tony was a great waiter. The salsa and guacamole were really fresh. 
Primo recommendations. Would definitely visit again and recommend to friends.

Sometimes in life you are lucky enough to encounter an experience tailor crafted for you...it doesn't happen often...but when it does it's something to be remembered...this exact thing happened here last night...when we arrived at the bar the entire bar staff walked us through happy hour (4:30-6:30 pm) and took the time to explain the hand crafted cocktails and garnishes to us...the bar itself is something to be seen...the beautifully decorated shelves and copper accessories will keep your eyes entertained while you wait for your cocktail to be made to perfection...at $5 the happy hour margarita and house nachos are a complete steal!!!!!!! Deliciously fabulous...whilst waiting for friends I enjoyed these in the bar area and moved to  the dining room when my friends arrived...after being kindly escorted to our table, we began a food ordering frenzy! Guacamole, queso, ceviche, habanero shrimp with a jalape√±o tamale, flautas...you name it, we ordered it. I think we barely spoke while we ate...everything was DIVINE. My friends also ordered mojitos and micheladas which they raved about...the manager Julian was sure to stop by and chat with us during our meal...what a fine gentleman...we felt so welcomed and looked after...which often times in Vegas, is a lost art in the hospitality industry...we can't say enough good things about this new neighborhood gem! We will most certainly be back often. Thank you Bandito for a wonderful evening out!

I'm saying this as a public service announcement. 

Come here now. Location is just off the strip so you can get away from it all with a simple jaunt down flamingo ... the ambience/decor is a breath of fresh air after being in the contrived casinos. Ok... but now the important part. Food. 
I love Austin tacos. Love them. Soooo.... that said... we went with the triple taco plate. Carne asada... Al pastor...and the barbacoa. Next level guys. And we drank the house bandito sauce. Haven't had anything approaching an AUSTIN taco anywhere but Banditos here in  Las Vegas. 

As we came in, Kent the owner walked around to show us the spray painted murals and just sat for a moment to talk about his approach to putting all this together. It was refreshing. You can tell this is a team here, Our waitress Jessica is just a great human and you can tell they all care about their restaurant experience they serve up. 

Love it when you find a place like this!!

I wonder if I could snag an Airbnb within walking distance for the next conference in Vegas.

Went to Bandito's the first week they opened.  Ordered the carnitas tacos.    The waiter brought out our items at different times and brought me the wrong item.  When my item showed up, it was barely room temp.  Overall flavor was good but needed a sauce or something to liven it up. They also need some hotter salsa.  The waitress over charged us for the sides even though they were included.  It all ended up being fixed but the lunch turned into an exceptionally long lunch.  The decor is fabulous and very chic.  Very modern and inviting.  Will have to go back after they have been open a bit longer...perhaps for happy hour.
Really enjoyed the Bandito turkey taco salad for lunch. Layers of flavor with the right amount of spice.
Very happy with the service. Been here several times and the food has been excellent each time.  The Carne Asada tacos are awesome.
Excellent food.  Even my picky teenager who typically doesn't like Mexican/Latin food (he's Chinese) really wants to go back.  Can't wait to go back for date night.
Awesome New Mexican place. Ambience was great, service was excellent and food loaded with flavor!

Great place for lunch meetings. It's not too loud, great modern decor, and the architectural design just lends it's self for conversation. The food is outstanding, and the portion sizes are perfect. The cherry on top was their server Jessica, who greeted us with her wonderful smile and friendly attitude. I would definitely come again.

My two friends and I really enjoyed our meal at Bandito.  The decor is beautiful and inviting.  We came in for a late meal and thought they might close soon.  But the host encouraged us to come in and take our time ordering.  As soon as we sat down, we were served some delicious chips and salsa.  Our waiter "Tony" gave us some great recommendations.  The 3 of us split two entrees:  fish tacos and carne asada enchiladas with a tasty green sauce (sorry, I don't recall the sauce name).  The entrees came with 3 items per order and Tony had the entrees split on 3 plates for us.  What a nice extra touch.  It was a LOT of food, but we ate it all.  My favorite thing on the plate was their version of elote.  I would definitely come back here on my next trip to Vegas.

This is Bandito's the NEW Las Vegas hot spot. What a wonderful refreshing Latin feel this place offers. 

The food is amazing and the staff are outstanding!  I recomend this as a Must Visit Restaurant and Cantina just off the Las Vegas strip.

Location: 
-easy to find (located in Howard Hughes Ctr) btwn Lawrys and STARBUCKS, off the strip
-Plenty of FREE PARKING in front
-good atmosphere: comfortable seating and great place to have dinner conversation (unlike many hectic places on the strip); there are tvs for the sports fans

We ordered:
-pork belly argula salad: FAV dish, unique and flavorful,  PLENTY of pork belly!! I only wished it was a little crunchier.
-surf and turf (carnivals, shrimp and cheese tamales): shrimp was best part of this dish
-albondigas (meatballs only...we were surprised that this wasn't soup... that was our mistake): it was ok. We wouldn't order again.
-sopas (roasted vegs, carnitas, barbarcoa): we enjoyed the roasted vegs the best and that they were bite sized and two of each(which was perfect for our party of 2)
-I don't drink anymore, but I noticed some unusual drinks like avocado margaritas... sounded interesting

Customer service:
-this was 5 stars
-super friendly

I would definitely return. I really enjoyed the atmosphere esp. for a place in Vegas. It's not cheap, but relaxing. I think they have a HH but don't know the details.

Came in for "date night" with my husband as we were wanting a place with a great bar and good food. We found it! 

We were here for happy hour which starts at 4:30 and runs until 6:30. Had their $5 margaritas and 1/2 off starters. The drinks were wonderful not your typical "watered down happy hour drinks" these are well made and good quality. 

The food was fantastic - the guacamole is fresh and creamy, ceviche was perfect and fresh, nachos (with added carne asada) was tasty and huge and just for fun we finished with chicken flautas that were perfectly flaky and full of chicken. 

The staff is top notch. We were greeted immediately by the chef who welcomed us from the kitchen as soon as we walked in, the hostess came right over smiled and was cheerful and easy going as we got to decide where we wanted to sit. Our servicer, Colleen was friendly, knowledgeable and super personable; she took super care of us and made our date night super relaxed. 

The atmosphere is modern, open, funky and new. We cannot wait until it cools down a bit so we can enjoy the patio and the city lights. 

We are locals and will definitely be back and will tell all our friends about our new place  

Keep up the great work and standards Bandito's, your crushing it.

I feel bad leaving a one star review but we had a very unpleasant time at this restaurant this week. I suggest going elsewhere! Cool decor; however service and food quality were awful.

We are local and live very close to this restaurant so we were very excited to give a new neighborhood restaurant a try. The design of the restaurant is stunning! But that's all I have for a positive note.

We went to the restaurant this week on a weekday and the restaurant was not busy, mostly open tables. We walk in and hostess is just starring at us, no greeting. Then waiter doesn't greet us for quite awhile once seated, when he does, he says he will be back and he has another assistant server helping him. The second server comes no greeting just places water and chips and salsa. The salsa was actually awesome! The waiter took at least another ten minutes to return then takes order, I got a beer, I kid you not it took 30 minutes to get a beer, and I was watching the bartenders doing side jobs and relaxing, um can I pour my own beer at this point? Server just kept coming to the table saying your beer will be right out...the whole time this is happening I am watching the hostess walk back and forth through the restaurant space eating chips....back and forth eating chips in the middle of the restaurant! The manager is just walking in circles doing nothing, when all guests around us looked irritated with the experience.

Ok fine, maybe I can ignore all of these service issues and the food will be fine. Food comes, I ordered the Baja Fish Tacos, he ordered the Al Pastor Tacos. My tacos were so over cooked they tasted more like chicken strips than fish. No flavor on either taco just bland cheap ingredients, not even plated well. When we are paying $21 for a plate of 3 tacos with one bite of beans, rice and corn on the side you expect it to be at least semi flavorful. 

Too expensive, poor service, horrible food quality.

I will not be visiting this establishment again and I hate to have to say it but I would suggest you don't either :/.  So many other decent restaurant options close by, not worth it to go here. Sorry.

This is trendy hipster at its finest. This isn't somewhere I would go out of my way to take people. Their food is great if you want someone to make your basic TexMex foods from recipes.com. Otherwise there is no soul and inspiration to their food. Just what you can expect from downtown Portland or Seattle. The atmosphere is stereotypical and borderline offensive but I guess that is what is popular these days. The price is for the location not the food. But the chips and salsa are incredible which is why this is two starts. Save your self the tasteless trendy hipster experience and go to any other authentic TexMex place in Vegas. They're a dime a dozen one block up or down from here and are cheaper with better atmosphere.
This is an excellent restaurant. The food is fresh and tasty. The seafood ceviche was awesome. Love the tacos al pastor and grilled octopus. Will come back next time I am in Vegas

Overall good experience at Bandito. Chips and salsa were great. I got the Smoking Bandito Margarita (half off during happy hour) and it was decent. I only wish there had been a pineapple wedge in it. The queso fondido was soooooo amazing. My favorite thing of the whole meal. We also ordered the fish tacos (not great) and the pastor tacos (pretty good but would be better shredded instead of cubed). For our side we got the corn which was delicious. The only think I would change is that the plates are so tiny! It was hard to eat off.  I LOVED the decor and atmosphere. Staff was excellent. We will return to try more.

LOVED the street corn and Aguas Frescas! We had fish tacos and their version of fajitas. They were good but I could go back just for the corn. It's a side dish for the fish tacos and we got another order since it was so good. It was awesome! I also got the strawberry aguas frescas and I really liked it. The service was really good and I really like the decor. Here is a picture I took there.
This restaurant is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!! Best Sandia Margaritas I've ever had and the food was delish!!! Staff is great!!! Wished I lived here so I could go back!!
First time here visiting from Washington DC and came across cocktail waitress Diana and Enrique.   Super friendly and awesome service from the both of them.  Made us feel so welcome.  Will be back.
By far the best Mexican restaurant in town. Excellent service, waiters, management, etc. Definitely my only go to spot for authentic, high end, Mexican food.
Octopus tacos ..... saw it on the menu and had to come, lo and behold they were amazing. Great bartending staff. Highly recommend.
I've updated my review solely based on customer service.  The owner did reach out direct and wanted to rectify the issues mentioned so it does show that they care.

Vegas strip quality service and food for local prices! This place is a must try. The flavors of the food are just right and the creative cocktails are winning! Design of the restaurant is beautiful with an artsy flair. Highly recommend stopping in!!!

This was a place that was easy and convenient to the Marriott. Walking distance. The hostess who was also the bartender did a great job in balancing  the  bar and the earl of us. The food was good. Had 2 tacos al pastor and some tortilla soup. Very filling.

I've been to Las Vegas 5 times and this is among the handful of places I've gone to twice (and the ONLY one I've gone to twice in 24 hours). Their sauces are made in house; we tried the Red Bandito, Creamed Salsa Verde, and Habanero Pepper Blood--highly recommend all (the latter being a little too spicy for me, but perfect for my hubby). We got the chicken tinga enchiladas, from the plancho with white fish, and carne asada tacos--all unreal!! Even the chips and salsa were better than any other Latin restaurant I've been to. 

Get the street corn as your side, you won't regret it. 

Can't wait to go back to Vegas to eat here again! In the meantime I'm researching how to make my own copycat recipes from this place! Yum!

A few months ago, I was very excited to try this place and I was disappointed. As far as decor, it is a cool and modern place. However the service is not great at all and the food is okay.

I went on a Friday night and it was empty in there except for a few people around the bar area. My boyfriend and I were seated at a huge table even though it was the two of us. Then our server only visited our table a total of 2 times (once to get our drink order and once to bring the check). We had random workers stop by to ask how things were and to bring out our food. They weren't very organized and every interaction was kind of awkward.

Although the service was not great, I believe that it could be fixed if the staff would have interacted with each other a little more and had a game plan for the few customers in the restaurant. They just seemed so unsure of themselves and we could pick up on it. Despite everything though, the chicken quesadillas were good.

Wow! Last minute plan to grab dinner with mom. Had seen IG review...thought we'd give it a try. Sooooo glad we did. Food was amazing - from the ceviche to the tacos. Drinks were even better!!  And the staff - except Carlos and Julian were incredible. Just kidding!!!  Carlos and Julian made our night!!!  Definitely will be back!  Thank you guys for making it such an incredible night.
So excited to have this new gem in town. Food and drinks are excelente! Cool ambiance and most of all, center of the strip! This will be our new local spot!

This is such an amazing restaurant. Love the atmosphere, food is incredible and staff are friendly and efficient. 
Leave room for dessert--  my personal favorite is the pineapple upside down cake but I will be going back soon to try the cheesecake (which I hear is amazing)
I promise you will be back. I went there on a Tuesday and came back on Saturday.

Lousy food which made my wife and I sick. We ordered chicken tacos but they first brought out fish tacos and didn't tell us. Then when they brought out the actual chicken tacos the sauce was terrible and the chicken didn't taste fresh. The chicken tasted like what someone would find at KFC i.e. poor quality meat. In addition, we arrived during happy hour but were never given a happy hour menu and only found out after having already ordered and hearing another table ask for the happy hour menu. All in all a lousy experience. Over priced for the money. Avoid this restaurant and go elsewhere.

Stopped in for an appetizer. The patio is dog friendly which is always a plus for me & my fur baby. They gave us complimentary chips and salsa that included a tomatillo salsa & regular one plus a secret extra hot one. The secret hot was good with a bit of heat but not too hot to enjoy. They also brought my dog a special little tasting. We ordered the chicken flautas. Very tasty. Came with 2 sauces. A red one & a jalape√±o verde. Verde was the stand out for me!  Service was great! Definitely would return.
The food is juat ok, our guac was crazy salty, they have almost no crema and guac with the entrees. The prices are fairly high but they still try to sell you stuff while you eat!
New Mexican restaurant close to the strip love the setting and ambiance at the bar,  food was very good ceviche,tacos and Gin and tonics and decent prices.

Enjoyed the soft opening night event and got to sample a few drinks and dishes. The chips and salsa are amazing. The green salsa was our favorite and will be a new craving for me. They offered us their "hot habanero salsa" in addition but we thought that is was the mildest of the three. Delicious, but mild. Maybe they're still working out the recipe. 

We started with the ceviche appetizer! Very fresh and had a perfect dice to the ingredients to pair with their chips. We did add a little lime juice to it to up the tartness.

Hubby got the Carne Asada tacos and loved the fresh tortillas. He got roasted veg on the side and said they were slightly too crispy/fresh still and he would have preferred a little more "roast" to them but he ate them all anyway. 

I had the Al Paster enchiladas with the Salsa Verde sauce and boy were those good. Lots of flavor in the sauces and I was swiping my rice and everything through my plate to get every drop. 

We got two drinks: Change Wango and the El Guapo Margarita with Grand Marnier Caviar. Both were perfectly balanced. Yum! We will be back!

Thank you for having us!

Bandito Latin Kitchen is about a mile off the main strip and has plenty of parking. ¬†We went for an early dinner, so there were not a lot of other customers. ¬†The ambience was very nice and comfortable. ¬†Almost anywhere you sit there are good panoramic views of the area around the restaurant. ¬†This is due to the openness of seating and windows all around, which also allows a great deal of natural light.

We were seated almost immediately (reservations are great) and our server was very attentive. ¬†She made the experience enjoyable and was very willing to guide us through the menu.

Now to the most important part, the food. ¬†We had the carnitas and the carne asada tacos, they were both very good. ¬†The sides were beans, rice and something akin to pico de gallo but with cherry tomatoes. ¬†The beans and rice were passable but not great and the pico was interesting. ¬†We also had drinks (Mojitos) and those were also good.


Overall, we would recommend this restaurant for an enjoyable dinner away from all the crowds of the Vegas strip.
Every bite and every sip was fresh and full of flavor. We travel a lot and eat at many fine restaurants. This rivals anything we've eaten. Superb!!!

We were headed to another restaurant and stopped at the stoplight. I look over and see this cool modern building and I thought it was so cute so we stopped! Omg I'm so glad we did! The inside decor is so bright and vibrant! The food is yummy! We ordered the seafood ceviche, guacamole, Grilled Halibut Tacos, and Octopus Tacos with an extra side of street corn. We had our 1.5year old with us and he had a kids order of chicken quesadilla. Overall this place is great, the staff was sweet and it's family friendly! Would def come back at night for drinks and tacos with the girls!

Love it! The food it amazing, very flavorful and creative. I had a turkey taco salad and it was not what I was expecting but absolutely delish. The service was fantastic, some of the best I've ever had. The atmosphere was beautiful. Definitely coming back here!

My mom and I had dinner here on a Friday night before seeing a show.

Our server was great!  He was extremely friendly and honest about his food preferences.

We ordered the guacamole to start (which we got for free for checkin' in)!  We also both got margaritas on the rocks ($9 each).  They were delicious! And strong (that's always a win).

I ordered the brick pressed roasted chicken which was pretty tasty.  It had roasted vegetables, potatoes al pastor, pickled fennel, guajillo, and chicken thyme jus.  My mom had the tacos al pastor, which she also really liked.  This came with manchego cheese, white onion, and pineapple. It also came with corn, beans, and rice.  

Our bill for the both of us came out to around $60 - not too bad.

We absolutely loved the decor!! Beautiful restaurant.

We ate there twice in 4 days, happy hour both time. Margaritas at $5 were delicious. Service was good though we had to ask for water 3 times the second time we were there. Two of us had 4 margaritas and 2 apps with enough left over for a meal at home, all for $32. The decor is beautiful. We will be back.

This is a hidden gem east of the Strip. The restaurant is located across the street from The Tuscany Hotel and Casino. Let me start by saying the service is EXCELLENT! Ashley the server was extremely attentive and helpful with the menu. The food was outstanding as well starting with their homemade salsas. They carnitas plancha came out hot and sizzling and it wasn't just for show. The food was delicious. I rarely order dessert but this seemed like a good opportunity to. I had the tres leeches cake. Huge portion and yummy. Coming from LA and knowing good Mexican food, I can honestly say this is one of the most enjoyable meals I had. Homemade, delicious and satisfying. I will definitely make a trip here again!

Great service ! great happy hour ....staff went above and beyond . Sopes and salsa were great my life liked the ceviche ...slip the guacamole  ...margaritas were strong . Didn't delve into the main menu but will probably try one day . All in all great value for happy hour ..cool space good vibe

The food is nothing to rave about... the portions are very small and the presentation of food is even worse. The drinks were the only thing worth the prices. We gave it a try to try something new. I think the food is very over priced for what you get. It also took an extremely long rime to get anything we ordered, including desert. The restaurant itself is very nicely decorated, but I feel that is what you're paying for... will not be returning.

In town for a business trip. Tried this place as per suggestion from our Uber driver. Wow! So glad we did! We tried a little bit of everything and barely made a dent! Guacamole, Shrimp plancha, Carne asada plancha, watermelon mint fresca, and I had a signature margarita! All was wonderful! The service was fantastic, friendly, and accommodating! A fabulous way to kick off our trip! Recommend!
Great food & service !!!! Thank you Jose for your wonderful hospitality and recommendations !!!!

We walked from our hotel to this lovely restaurant and not being use to desert heat we were dying, when we walked in the host immediately got us water as we looked like death warmed over.  We then were promptly sat.  They brought out more water and then chips and salsa,  the salsa is fantastic and you get both a tomatillo and another tomato based and they are great!  I was talking with the waitress and I mentioned I like spicier salsas and she brought me another one that was fantastic.  We also got the guacamole and it was one of the best I have ever had. 

We then ordered and I got enchiladas with the fabulous Mole sauce and my sweat heart got the tacos, we both did the barbacoa (SP?) and it was very tasty.  It was a little fatty but that just added to the flavor.   You will not be disappointed at all.

PS. Get the Mexican style corn it is great!
Amazing staff!!! So friendly and accommodating! Food and drinks are to DIE for!! Will definitely be back again and again!

Went to dinner with a few friends and everything was good but the service. Suzanne's service was the worst we've had. Made asking for a glass of water to getting our check split felt like an inconvenience. Rolled her eyes and gave attitude when asked for a glass with our beers. Not to mention we had a pretty easy going 6 top on what seemed like a slower day.
The price for my girlfriend and I was not worth the bad service.

Loved this place. It's a casual atmosphere. The decor is gorgeous. Our server was super friendly and made some pretty tasty drinks. We had the guacamole and queso as appetizers...delish. I had the smoking margarita and the Sandia margarita. Both absolutely tasty. My aunt and Uncle had the Guapo margarita and it was AMAZING. Don't let the caviar freak you out. Little bursts of tastiness in your mouth. All of us had different types of tacos and everyone raved how good their food was. We also had a magician who came to the table and he was like whoa. Our heads are still reeling with the "how'd he do that?" We has a great experience and will be returning again soon!

We were in town visiting and decided to try something off the strip. We found Bandito and made reservations.  The place has really cool decor and a nice ambience. We were seated immediately and the host was very friendly.  The menu looked amazing. I had the halibut enchiladas and my husband had the plancha with steak and shrimp. As an app we had the chicken quesadilla.  Our waiter Carlos was so nice and very attentive. It seemed like he was waiting all the tables at the restaurant but was moving quickly and getting around to all of them. We loved the food and service here. We would definitely come back.

I stopped by to enquire about a Christmas party... Tony and Enrique have been so accommodating and informative. I actually stayed to sample the food and drinks. Everything was delicious...True authentic Mexican Cuisine. I'm hooked!
Nice place really good food and excellent service looks like the out really attention of details of the flavors of the food

I rarely give a 5 star.  But in Vegas I find unique eats hard to find.  This place was awesome.  I actually told the waitress bring me something unique, spicy and seafood.. my spicy shrimp was awesome! The owner cares about everything.  Although unlikely, if something is amiss... let him know.  He'll make it right.  Cannot wait to come back.  (Please don't tell your friends)

Fabulous. Had Shrimp Habanero and thought it was outstanding. Delicious roasted veggies and very large serving. Good margarita. Our server brought 2 guacamole one of which was free with yelp. Said he just brought 2 because there were 5 of us - classy!  Loved the decor and will be back again.
Love the chips and salsa and the watermelon Margarita was perfect. The decor was absolutely beautiful!

Lucky charm strikes again.  Lauren C. made the suggestion of Bandito for dinner.  She has great suggestions!

It was later in the evening on a weekday so it was easy to get seated immediately.  Our waiter, Carlos, was absolutely a gem all night.  He made us feel like VIP's with his service and charm.  His attentiveness was definitely noticed and appreciated.  

As per usual Mexican fare, complimentary chips and salsa were brought to the table.   Carlos asked us if we liked spicy salsa and offered to bring out their habanero salsa.   Holy spicy!  But it had a good flavor spicy which we all enjoyed.  My husband and I decided to split the Chicken Quesadilla as well as the Carnitas Enchiladas. The quesadilla was filled to capacity with chicken, charred heirloom tomatoes, caramelized onions and cheese.  The sweet caramelized onions lifted the flavors to greatness.  The dollop of guac and crema sauce gave a nice compliment to the appetizer.  

The enchiladas were no slouch.  The tender carnitas rested gently on top of the enchilada that is filled with cheese and your choice of sauce.  It is accompanied with the traditional pico de gallo, guac and crema sauce.  For our enchilada sauce option, we went with the habanero pepper sauce.  This wasn't nearly quite as hot as their habanero salsa but it still had a great kick and flavor.  The normal rice and beans came with it but the dish also comes with an additional choice.  Let's try the Off the Cob Mexican Street Corn!  Yes it was a great choice and would order again and again.

The kitchen was accommodating since my husband has a cilantro aversion.  All of our dishes were cilantro free and he deeply appreciated their awareness.  I'm excited for this unique kitchen and cantina.  Im already looking forward to my next visit!

Excellent Mexican food off of the Vegas strip.  Fresh, high quality ingredients reasonably priced.  The place has a nice ambiance and some amazing fresh salsa options.  I recommend the chips and guacamole as a starter followed up with the habanero shrimp- will not disappoint.

Customers service and venue I would rate 10/10 everybody was so professional and the place was beautiful! The food I was very disappointed I would rate it a 3/10  the menu was only a page long not much to chose from and  not what I was expecting at all. Funny thing is the drink menu had more options. My appetizer was the soup it was room temperature (not hot)and too spicy and I order a side of Mexican corn which was really good! My entr√©e was the tacos which wasn't good I think Roberto's taco are way better! Lol I did order a cocktail which was ok. So for the price which is more then a traditional Mexican restaurant was over priced just not worth it!

This is awesome Mexican food!  They have really, really good cocktails too and specialize in mixology with different drinks.  We ordered a bunch of food to share and all of it was excellent.  It's easy to see why the RJ rated them as one of the best, new restaurants to open in 2017.  The quesadillas are the best I've ever had (and I've eaten a million of them in my life).  They mix carmelized onions with a really tasty red sauce.  The conqueso was extraordinary.  Definitely give them a try because it's a fabulous place.

New Mexican restaurant in the Howard Hughes Center. Excellent food and terrific service- especially so for being a brand new establishment. Chicken tacos were very good. House made chips (shipped to property al dente and finished in their frier) were terrific. Roasted corn side with tacos was the bomb. Good solid Mexican food at very reasonable prices in a cool environment. Recommend.
Awesome new place!! Our new favorite happy hour spot! $5. Dollar margaritas. Win/Win!! Enrique the bartender was super helpful and pleasant! Super cute inside too!!

As a professional woman I expect exemplary service when I patronage an establishment. Our service was good by our guest services agent however as a group of 10 we were approached by the owner and our bill was "reviewed" to examine the amount of money netwe'd spent during the course of our meal. We live in a time when we continue to experience the subtle hints of unfounded discrimination. The food was decent, the service by our waitress was good however the owner made it very clear that our group of minorities was unwelcome in his establishment. Make no mistake, I speak with my dollars and I will not be returning the this business in the future. Far too many places to spend my money in Las Vegas, Bandito's will never get another one of my dollars...shame on you!

My daughter noticed Bandito's as we were driving up flamingo, its Structure Is very similar to " The Patio" in Chicago, so we decided we would try it. We returned the next day with my son, and son - in - law. The host was really welcoming, as well as the server who sat us at our table. The interior was really wonderful , the staff was friendly. And the presentation of the food was gorgeous. I ordered the burrito with chicken , blood orange sauce, and a side of mexican street corn. The corn was delish, the burrito was great, and the blood orange sauce was the right amount of spicy. I would go back and I would recommend it.

Went to Bandito for a late lunch and was pleasantly surprised with the food. Great guacamole and salsas. The ceviche was also pretty good. Decor of the restaurant is cool. I would definitely suggest checking this place out. I'll be back.

Food was very lackluster. The guacamole was under-seasoned and over-limed. The street corn was okay. I have zero clue to how a place can charge $17 for carnitas & al pastor tacos (only two tacos). I despise the restaurant chain Chile's, but they actually have better food than Bandito. The Chips and salsa suck too. Overall: stay away. Better off going to any other place or starving yourself than eating at Bandito.

I came here for Happy Hour on a Tuesday with my friends and was very excited to finally try this spot. I haven't heard much about it but the decor and atmosphere looked great when i walked in. My friends and i ordered margaritas ($5 for HH is a steal.. and they were strong) then we proceeded to look at their food menu. The server told us that all the appetizers were half off during HH (also a great deal being that their prices were a bit high for Mexican food). So...I ordered the fried octopus, ceviche, and chips and salsa. My friends ordered guac, nachos and sopas. *Note: they do not have any taco specials for taco Tuesdays. (Update: So apparently they do have a Taco Tuesday special...however our server didn't mention anything about it. Wish I knew!)

Let's start with my fried octopus... turns out it was NOT octopus. I grabbed a big piece and cut it in half and thought it didn't look like octopus. I took a bite of the half i had cut off and guess what...? it was chicken (texture and flavor of chicken breast, not octopus-if you've eaten octopus before, you'd know that it has a chewy yet tender texture). I had my friend try a piece as well and she also confirmed that it was a piece of chicken. I couldn't believe that this overly fried, almost burnt tasting piece of "octopus" was a chicken nugget. For the record, I've had octopus many times in different ways.. grilled, fried, raw, etc. I immediately told my server and without any explanation or reassurance, he apologized and took it away. Now my ceviche was good (it was on the sweeter side because of the mangoes but it was tasty), along with my chips and salsa which was fresh. The server even brought out their habanero salsa which was so delicious(super spicy but flavorful). The guac was average and the nachos were very sad looking (very plain and boring with minimal toppings). The sopas were good but the protein (carnitas & carne Asada) on them were small. 

Overall, the margaritas were nice and strong, the habanero salsa was my favorite, and the server was attentive and kind. Besides that, the portions for HH is extremely sad. It just felt very pretentious because you can tell that the portions were definitely "HH portions". I'm pretty disappointed at the fact that they served me "fried octopus" when in fact they were friend little pieces of chicken. I honestly feel tricked.. I don't know if they ran out of octopus or what but they could've just 86'd the item and save us the trouble. The server was kind enough to take it off my check but a manager never came to the table to apologize or explain/justify the fried faux octopus. I don't think I'd come back to Bandito.. but if it did, I'd only get a margarita and chips/salsa anyways which means i can go to any other Mexican restaurant with better prices and portions.

I stopped by for lunch mid day. It's a great place for fast service. We were seated right away & received our drinks and food fast. Our waitress was very friendly she recommended places for us to visit. I ordered the fried fish tacos and barbacoa michelada.

Bandito's gorgeous black-and-red space is located just off the Strip, with a sweet Happy Hour deal from 4:30-6:30 featuring half off apps and $5 margs.  Recently came in with a group to try a bunch of dishes, and I'm looking forward to going back to try a few more. 

The chicken flautas were one of my favorite dishes, with a mild dipping sauce and a flavorful filling. The nachos are served as a giant mountain and worth the upcharge to add protein- the asada was nicely soft but I also liked how juicy the carnitas was without sacrificing crispiness! The quesadillas were also a hit at our table, and the ceviche impressed in that what we initially thought were pieces of giant Peruvian corn were actually scallops. I will do some shady shit for nacho cheese, and I was disappointed to find that the queso fundido was thin and lacked flavor. I'm not much of a drinker but I appreciated that the $5 margs were a full glass rather than the smaller pours I've seen elsewhere. They were out of the octopus when we went, so I'll definitely be returning to give that a shot along with the sope sampler.

This was only my second time here, but I'm definitely a fan! Food and service were both very good and the atmosphere is bright, busy without being too loud, and inviting.

To start, I'm a sucker for a great bread, or in this case, chips and salsa. Bandito's doesn't disappoint. They offer two salsas - one green/tomatillo, the other red. We ordered guac and the tamale trio as our appetizers (the pork tamale was my favorite). I got the braised octopus tacos as my entree, hubby got the carne asada tacos. The octopus was perfectly cooked - tender and flavorful, but not overpowering. Just writing this review (a few days later) makes me want to go back, just for this dish!

Reservations are recommended.

I heard about this place from a friend.I am always looking for great food off the strip. Located at Hughes Center the parking was easy and plentiful. We stopped in for happy hour and it was perfect. $5 margaritas and half priced apps [ plenty to choose from ]. The turkey chorizo albondigas and tamale trio were a hit. I will be back for taco tuesday.This was the perfect way to end the work day. We sat in the bar and Nikki ,our bartender, was delightful. They did a great job with the decor and surprisingly it wasn't too crowded.

Just moved to the area.  This is right around the corner from my place and just off the strip.  The prices are more than reasonable, the food quality is great and the customer service is phenomenal.  This is a great local place and am happy to live close to it and support it.
Great service, food was kind of pricey but tasted great.  Overall a pretty good experience, and a nice off the strip location!

***Review for 6/6/17

My experience here was simply 'okay.' My co-worker and I tried this place for lunch a few days after their soft launch, so we knew going it not to expect 100% on point service. Honestly, the slow service wasn't even that big of an issue. Ultimately I was just not really impressed by the food. 

The style was more of 'chef inspired dishes' that failed to wow. The portions were small and the price tag rather large. I had the enchiladas and they were teeny tiny. The sauce options seemed promising, but I wasn't wowed by any of them either. My dish also came with a side of roasted veggies. This happened to be a few slices of bell peppers and two small baby corns. On the bright side, they included chips and salsa at no cost and the chips were quite delicious. They do have a full bar, but we did not partake for this visit. 

The space itself is also a little bit on the small side, meaning it's a bit more intimate and not really a great place for a group. We were also informed their 'happy hour' is only for drinks or apps ordered at the bar and two designated high tops. I can't image it being easy to have happy hour here when it's busy on a Thursday or Friday evening. 

Merely an average place, but still decent enough Mexican cuisine if you're craving it!

Heard about this new place and had to try it out when a friend came to visit us from overseas. So, we came here for dinner last night. Our waiter, Tony, was awesome! He made great recommendations on food and even concocted an amazing adult beverage for a friend of mine. The food is delicious with such a blast of flavor! The restaurant has a good vibe. Great place for large groups or even a romantic dinner out. They accommodated me when I asked if they could modify my order a bit. I didn't expect the outstanding customer service. They exceeded my expectations! We will definitely be back!

We came here during lunch yesterday and the service was terrible. We got seated immediately and we're given our menus but we didn't see our server for nearly 30 minutes before getting our drink order. We also had to get another employee to bring us chips n salsa a because we were sitting there for at minimum 20 minutes before bringing that to us. The food was good no complaints there but we also asked the server to bring the Habanero sauce which he forgot and we didn't see him till the meal was almost over.  I really hate to give this place two stars as the food was ok but without service I don't feel right giving them any more stars. With such poor service, it's definitely not works going back and paying +$25 for food and drinks.  Could be a regular as I work in the Business complex but won't be back
The service was excellent.  Our server was new and she did a wonderful job!  The staff was very accommodating as our group grew from 6 to 13 unexpectedly.

This place has it all. From the decor to the Margaritas, everything was excellent. We had a watermelon margarita and I wanted some spice so I asked the bartender (can't remember her name....super nice girl with a real interest in good service) to throw a little jalape√±o in my regular margarita, and it was really good. Guacamole was on point. Very fresh and bright (lots of lime juice! Yum). We shared the carnitas tacos entree which come with rice and beans and a 3rd side. We opted for the jalape√±o cheese tamale. All was very very good. We will def stop in here every time we are in town!  Oh....and the prices are great as well!!

Decided to go check this new place out for lunch a few days ago. My wife works in the Howard Hughes Center which is right next to Bandito's in this place has been much anticipated by people that work in that area.

It lived up to the hype in my opinion for sure! 

I went with the burrito. Got shrimp and chicken, beans, rice, salsa, guacamole. The shrimp were huge inside. There probably weren't many of them (maybe 3 jumbo) but it gave it great crunch and nice added flavor in my opinion. 

The guacamole was on the side and it was creamy. I generally prefer a little chunky guac but it was still very tasty and had grape tomato halves in it. 

On top, I had the salsa rojo which is supposed to have a little kick but did not have much of one in my opinion. I generally like spicy but what it lacked in kick it carried in flavor. 

The service was great. I realize that where new places often struggle is with their service. This was not the case at Bandito's. Our server was great, the other staff regularly filled my water. The manager came over to ask us how we were doing and then even removed some finished plates from the table. 

The place is very nicely decorated. They have a beautiful mural on the wall! Some nice soft music and great ambience. 

The burritos were about $18 a piece which is a little bit on the high side for a lunch outing but it's a nicer place so that's more accepted I guess. 

Give it a shot, I'll certainly be back!

came into today to check this place out with 3 other friends for lunch. upon entry the place is very new, trendy & has a very beautiful look. the owner happened to be who seated us & he was very welcoming, kind & even checked on how everything was during & at the end of our meal. we got the chips with the red salsa & green salsa, also tried to habanero Salsa which were all amazing! when you check in on Yelp you also get a complimentary chips & guacamole which I thought was a nice touch.  I got the carne asada tacos (sorry didn't take a picture but there's plenty on this yelp page lol) which came with rice, beans & a 3rd side of my choice which was the Mexican street corn which was pretty good as well! I give the carne asada tacos a 3.5/5. our servers name was Diane, she was so awesome, very patient, had a great attitude & also very personable. I would definitely eat here again! they've only been open for 4 months & it's going to be a nice addition to that area. I wish them the best of luck!

We love the happy hour and great service from the fantastic bartenders at Bandito. The watermelon margarita is not to be missed. Paired with their chips w guacamole and fresh salsas, you can't go wrong.
Greet new restaurant opening in Las Vegas.   The enchilada was superb.   Service was great and your meal isn't complete until your try their margaritas
This restaurant had a fun and artsy atmosphere. The food was good and the portions were adequate. I loved the use of fresh ingredients and farm to table dishes to include freshly squeezed lemonade!;)
Great decor and a good happy hour deal.  We probably tried all the appetizers and loved them all, including the house made salsa

The best tacos in town.  
Also the service is top notch. 
I highly recommend the octopus tacos and also the fish tacos. 
Everything is good here.

Banditos looked really awesome when we drove by the other day so we couldn't wait to check it out! Everything was amazing. We ordered guacamole which was awesome and you don't really need it because they will keep bringing chips and salsa for the table which is awesome on its own.

I had the carnitas enchiladas with Creamed Salsa Verde and they were delicious. They were different than normal enchiladas because the meat was on top but I loved that because I ended up eating more meat and less of the cheese.  My husband had a special which was the Cubano torta which was like a Cuban sandwich and he loved his as well. Our friends loved their food too and there was more than enough for all of us!

The service was great we dealt with the bartender, manager and server and they were all helpful, friendly and welcoming which can be difficult to find in Vegas. We will definitely go back!

Ambiance: Excellent, the colors and paintings of the restaurant is spectacular. The design isn't too flashy but it's very eye catching. The color coordination blends so smoothly making you look up after every bite 

Food: Amazing, Everything is so fresh and tasteful. You can taste fresh in each of the items they have. In my opinion that says a lot about a restaurant. 

Staff: Phenomenal, everyone is so friendly and helpful starting from the manager to host to kitchen staff. You guys are awesome. 

I recommend this place to anyone that has seen them. You must try it. Don't miss out

Bandito Latin Kitchen & Cantina located in the Hughes Center. Frontage on flamingo just between Koval & Paradise. The art work and decor gives a cool vibe ! There's a couple things I might change ! Still a cool looking spot overall. 
Being from a family full of Mexican food chefs and restaurant owners from Mexico , we can tend to be a little picky. Had to bring my mom in to give this place a second chance since she didn't care for her first experience. 
She ordered the Baja fish tacos the 2nd time around and she was satisfied. Woohoo! Lol. 

I ordered the carnitas enchiladas with salsa verde crema
Which I did enjoy. They actually prepare the enchiladas and add the protein on top of the enchilada which I thought was different. I actually think I'd prefer it that way now! 

There's a few things on the menu I'd like to come back and try but i come here during lunch hours on lunch break . Perhaps on a Tuesday I can come back at happy hour for taco Tuesday as tacos are 50% off. 
There are a couple of recommendations id like to make in-regards to the food ingredients/taste etc. 

I am not a fan of the salsa. We make salsa at home weekly. I know not everyone likes it the way I do however these salsas not only are way too mild and had no kick at all (I don't mind mild salsa at all) but these salsas were sweet tasting. When I don't finish all of the chips and salsa you know something is off for me. Perhaps offer something with a little more kick or even a little spice? 
In addition I noticed the same type of consistency in flavor with the rice and beans. It almost had a sweet taste to them as well. Now that i think about it if i could id just ordered the enchiladas alacart or just minus the rice and beans (I love rice n beans tho!) and keep the 3rd side they do offer like roasted veggies or corn.
I did enjoy the complimentary guacamole upon check in. The place wasn't too packed and the service was good. I'm giving this place the benefit of the doubt by giving them 4 stars . I think it has good potential .
Hopefully I can get back in here and try some cocktails and other dishes!

Back again for an update- 8 months later.  The consistency in staff and detail is refreshing.  The food is still sublime and the Margaritas deserve your attention.  I highly encourage you to bring your friends to Banditos for a feast they won't soon forget.  However, after a few more of these freshly muddled cucumber mojitos I just might- yummmm!

Please disregard all low-star reviews- now I know the truth.  Banditos is not just a pretty building on the corner of Flamingo and Howard Hughes- it is the new standard for Mexican cuisine.  I've been all over the country- So Cal, Austin, Miami, New York, Chicago, you name it- nothing is really close to this quality and attention to detail.  The staff, the food, the music, the ambiance- all are remarkable.  Let me explain...

We opened the door and are immediately greeted in the most gracious of ways- I feel underdressed already.  We are then seated immediately and given a specials menu that is explained in detail. Shortly thereafter, we are introduced to our server- a lovely and knowledgeable lady who is ready with the best recommendations.  The drinks come and they are amazing.  I am not a big drinker, so I choose the "special" Agua Fresca and my lady chooses an incredible vodka drink that arrives in a copper pineapple.  Stunning presentation and the fresh fruit hint at what we can expect when the food comes.  Complimentary chips are delivered with two salsas- both amazing.  But, I choose the fresh guacamole dip.  The freshly made chips and the guac are an irresistible combination.  Before the end of the meal I had every drop of the guac.  The meals recommended were delectable.  I had the Sea Bass and she had the carne asada and habanero shrimp plate.  Fresh grilled vegetables adorn both meals and provide a colorful experience.  It all comes together in an explosion of flavor that has you wondering when the last time was that you ever ate any meal this good.  It's been a great great while for this guy- and that was a meat and potatoes plate.

We were constantly checked on by the most well-trained and courteous staff I can remember.  The owner checked in as well.  Our entire experience took less than an hour.  You will not be disappointed with this restaurant.  Put Banditos on your shortlist of restaurants you must visit.

Awful.  We had such high hopes since we virtually live right across the street and have given it many chances but we are done.  The food is overwrought, fussy and bland.  It feels like this place is trying to find its identity.  With zero luck.  Their menu is confusing with all the different sauces...and the poor waiters have to spend 10 minutes explaining how the menu works!  Being from San Diego, California, we are used to great Mexican food.  This restaurant doesn't have a chance.  The silver lining?  They make a great margarita, albeit expensive, and their chips and salsa are good.

If you are looking for a new favorite restaurant look no further. The food, drinks, and friendly, genuine service made our experience so special. I don't have anything but positive things to say about this place. Also shoutout to Jared and Jordan. You two made our experience delightful.

The food and drinks were great, but they lost my reservation that I made over 2 weeks ahead of time for a corporate dinner. Luckily, we were still able to be seated, but it didn't make me look good to my bosses.
We went to dinner last night with a group of 12. The smoking Bandito Margarita was delicious. Fantastic cocktails overall. Food was amazing and service was the best! Highly recommended!!

Both the food and service is phenomenal!!!! Very tasty menu that can easily accommodate vegetarians. I ordered the enchiladas with habanero sauce, in place of meat they made them with roasted vegetables. The vegetables included rainbow carrots, purple and white cauliflower - not the typical boring bell peppers and onions. 

Great drinks as well! Fresh chips with two types of salsa and you can special order extra spicy salsa made with habanero peppers which has the perfect kick and won't leave your month on fire. 

Our server Susan was crazy amazing. Very knowledgeable about the spices, flavors and ingredients that go into the dishes. I've never experienced someone so welcoming at a restaurant.

I've been here a few times now.  My boyfriend comes more often.  I love the overall feel of the space.  The warm chips with two salsas that's served to start are awesome!  As for the menu and food. My food has been ok.  Nothing to rave about.  My boyfriend however loves and and the people he has sent to try it also love it... I am slightly a food snob though so maybe I'll continue to try new things until I find the item that makes me return.

I have to be honest...I wasn't expecting much. SO, what a pleasant surprise to have some pretty fantastic food.  Now, I'm going to get the names of the dishes all messed up...but the plata a la plancha with carnitas was so YUMMY!! I especially enjoyed the roasted veggies that were charred and sizzling from the bottom of the cast iron. Now, I don't really understand the habanero sauce that was on top of the dish, but the meat was cooked perfectly, so who cares. I didn't touch the accompaniments because I'm on a keto diet...so the meat and veggies were a PERFECT dinner for me. I didn't miss the tortillas, rice and beans at all.

My BF had the habanero shrimp and added steak option. SOOO good. 

Jose was a server.  Incredibly attentive without being overbearing.  He described all the food in great detail to help us understand all of the fancy Mexican herbs that we had never heard of before.  

Definitely will be back...maybe for happy hour on a non-work nite.

First time here for the wife and I. It was ok the place has great appeal but the food was ok . A place to
Go and check it out.

This place is amazing! It has instagram-friendly decor, the staff is extremely nice, food and drinks are great. Our waiter/bartender was super cool,he gave us some nice recommendations. We had seafood sevice as an appetizer, and some tacos, all were good. Octopus tacos are a must-try! One warning though: don't go too hard on free chips and salsa, because portions are pretty big. In had to take half of food to go. Micheladas are great, and
mojitos are super refreshing. We were the last ones to leave, and we didn't feel rushed by the staff. It was definitely a 5-Star experience

I'm a Vegas local, being also in the hospitality business is what brought me to try this new place, I would have to say this has been a phenomenal, very tasteful Mexican cuisine experience. The sopes appetizer platter hits the stop and it's almost as good as grandmas.... lol. My friend and I sat at the bar, we had such great service by the bartenders, they were knowledgeable about their tequilas and mezcal. I would recommend it and definitely come back for more.

Everything was excellent. Carlos was our server and was extremely attentive. Fish tacos and Pan fried Halibut were both excellent as was the street corn. This is a place that will be around for a long time.
Great food, good service and a decent atmosphere.  The fajitas are excellent, and a little different, with some great fresh veggies

Exceeded my expectations by FAR!!! 
I will definitely be back. 

Carne Asada taco
Octopus taco and 
Baja Fish taco. 

Fresh made and delicious salsa too
Amazing place! Great food, great ambience, our server was amazing don't remember her name ! Cute girl with a Mohawk

Delicious upper crust latino cuisine. Reggaeton music playing in the distant while the friendly service brings out the hot specialty dishes. Perfect night to try Bandito out for the first time,  National Margarita day! 
Safe walking distance to the strip,  next to some hefty competiton for dining options here on Flamingo. Upscale Hispanic ambiance with surrounding glass walls boasts post familial alley with a modern Latino vibe. And in the middle of the floor a bar carrying all your tequila dreams and margarita mixed drinks.
The food was so fresh and delicious. Chicken,  pork,  beef, seafood and fresh fish selections. Empandas were made fresh, and sat atop a nice corn salsa. Hot tortilla chips served with 3 different smooth salsas (make sure you ask to try their hot variation ).
Several different margaritas to choose from to wash that down with.

The customer service was just great !!!! ..while we drove to firefly and it was extremely crowded and no parking decided to try an alternative and man sure glad we did ....plenty of parking space no lines the vibe walking in was high end cantina is very well put together I'm prego so I can't drink but the bar looked inviting ....we were seated no problem got our drink order in fast they brought out home made warm chips and green and red salsa (kinda spicy) but good . Ofcourse I had to get a side of guacamole also made from scratch and had a ton of flavor ! I ordered 2 asada tacos and 1 chicken taco it came with rice and beans I have nothing negative to say about all of it ! A place I want to come with a big group of friends or my family good chill ambience

Came in to try this place on a Monday night. We were seated right away, but at a very awkward table since we needed room for a high chair. The service, after that, went down hill. Our server was incredibly slow getting our order taken and then placed. The food was ok but nothing really stood out, except the wrong order of tacos that they brought out, or the dessert they brought us before we received our entrees that was supposed to go to another table. It got noticeably worse when other guests were complaining about the 20 minutes it took to get their check. Then we had to ask 2 people to get our check because our server couldnt be found. I really wanted to enjoy this place but I dont think there was anything that would make me want to come back. Great looking resturaunt, decent food, sub par service.
Worst bar experience ever. Hands down...Three bartenders, no one sitting at the bar and could not get proper (water, etc) attention. Never again, period......

Super excited to try this new place and it did not disappoint! We started with queso for an appetizer which was an excellent choice! I had the chicken tacos and my friend had enchiladas. Both were excellent. But what was more impressive was the service! Our servers name was Paul and he made wonderful suggestions on the menu. He was very knowledgeable and professional. The level of service was top notch! We will definitely be back and will request Paul as a server.

Stopped in here for a quick meal + was really impressed with the service. In addition to the chips + salsas, we ordered the side of guacamole, a jalape√±o cheese tamale, + the quesadilla (which we made vegetarian). Everything was fresh + filling. The space is open + bright. Service was very fast + friendly, would definitely return.
Awesome atmosphere and great food.  Ask for Stacey...  She's a cutie with a booty who keeps the beer flowing until you yell "STOP!"

Great Mexican inspired restaurant. The highest quality fresh ingredients are used in everything. I had the guacamole, which was outstanding and the carnitas enchiladas. The enchiladas are made with cheese only and then you pick the sauce and meat. A great lunch, I certainly plan to go back.

So, here we are at Bandito's again.  Can I say that we really enjoy this place?  We found it by accident while driving down Flamingo - and I am so glad that we did.  It's an affordable upscale cantina that has the most delicious food served by attentive staff who truly go the extra mile to make the dining experience memorable.  We have been back a handful of times, and have plans to make this one of our preferred restaurants.  Highly recommended!

This place immediately became my favorite spot for Mexican food! It's located 3 blocks east of the Las Vegas Strip. The food is authentic and delicious. It's a little pricey compared to other Mexican restaurants, but you definitely get what you pay for.  

The Watermelon Margarita comes highly recommended. 

We started off with Asada Nachos. It was a great shareable portion. We also ordered the green chicken enchiladas, it comes with rice and beans and you get to choose a 3rd side. I picked the jalape√±o and cheese tamale. My husband ordered the tacos de asadas, his also came with rice and beans and he chose the Mexican street corn on the side. We were blown away with how phenomenal the food was! It's so hard so find a good Mexican restaurant that has such an authentic taste. 

Service was great. Our server was on his "A" game. Checked in on us frequently and made sure we were well taken care of. 

We can't wait to come back again!
Service was great! The food was wonderful. Simple Mexican made into a very nice meal. I loved it
This place great. Went with there with 3 other friends on a work trip. Jose c best waiter ever
The food was alright! Nothing that I would write home about. The server was nice and it was a really beautiful setting.

Meep 

So my friend wanted to try this place after she found it on yelp so I went with it

The decor is super cute our waitress was super nice and made sure she checked on us ....

We got our drinks before we got our water that we originally asked for 

But blahhhhh the food was not even worth the price they lack in flavor ALOT we order the ceviche octopus and my friend ordered a salad 

You do a get a free check in guacamole I didn't even try it honestly the chips definitely don't taste fresh like house made 

The ceviche does not stand out it had nothing to make it special it looked pretty but it wasn't special not much flavor and boring 

The octopus dipping sauce was great as long with the dish 

But as in terms for a restaurant it's nothing special at all there are so many way better places then here and I love food and I really don't write bad reviews but skip this place there's way better all over
Great food and attentive service.  Green salsa was fantastic!  Prices were a bit high, but shareable serving sizes.

Great new Latin restaurant! It's only been open six months and is worth the visit. It's located just off of the Strip and has a nice industrial vibe. The staff is friendly and very accommodating. The food is great! The Queso Dip was amazing as was the Grilled Halibut Tacos with Al Pastor Potatoes. The menu allows you to pick your side and protein, so you have wiggle room to have the meal you want. Also, try the Jalape√±o Margarita! It's really good! Thanks to Tashalee for taking care of us!

This restaurant is awesome! The vibe, decor, and ambience is amazing.  I ordered the chicken flautas and the off the cob street corn. The corn didn't taste like elote, but it was so delicious.  The flautas had were cheesy with a mixture of chicken.  My friend's ordered the carne asada tacos.  The meat had a great flavour and it was tender. They also loved the rice and beans. The service was great,  the manger and waitress were very informative, helpful,  and friendly.  We also sampled three desserts which we all ages were good.  I hope to see those desserts on the menu soon on our next visit.

I had been wanting to try this place since they opened. I'm a huge fan of Mexican food so I was eager to see what this place was about.

Went in around 430 or so. It was pretty empty besides a couple of tables. We asked to sit in the bar area to take advantage of the happy hour. Hostess wasn't sure if we could have happy hour at the regular tables or just in he bar so we sat in the bar area to be safe.

Our waitress came to us rather quickly. Explained that the happy hour had some drink specials and that the appetizers were half off. We decided to go with a couple house margaritas and the queso fundido.

Margaritas were good. Couldn't really taste the tequila but what do you expect for happy hour. Have it a solid 3/5 for the margarita.

I was excited about the queso. A lot of people spoke highly of it. I guess the big deal is that it comes out still bubbling hot. Other than that it was just ok. After it cooled it was very soupy. Small portion as well. If it wasn't for the happy hour I wouldn't recommend it. I know I know... I'm not cheap but come on, yo can go to places like Lindo Michoac√°n and get the same for about the same price but a bigger portion... and yes I'm sure you're paying for the quality. But still. Had to give it a 3/5.

Got the cup of tortilla soup. Very disappointed. Flavor was good but there was literally a chunk of what seemed to be previously frozen chicken breast in it. No real ingredients per say. Some tortilla strips on the top and a little cheese but in all honesty the tortilla soup from BJs is a little better. 3/5 also.

Had the elote also. Huge fan of Mexican corn. This was probably my favorite thing here. Corn if off the cob and has that sour mayo taste to it that we all know and love. 5/5 for this for sure.

My friend had a combo that came with the tamale. This wasn't the best I've had and not the worst. Tasted dry and a bit too much mass versus the filling. 2/5 for this one.

I did enjoy the michilada. Pretty tasty and they had the chicharron as garnish. They need to have more options with the chicharron as a the star. Just a salad comes with it. Gave that a 5/5.

Overall it's a fantastic looking spot. Not too far from the strip and it's extremely trendy and clean. But for good Mexican good there's plenty more options.

Cool place, good environment, friendly staff, mostly reasonable prices for a vegas tourist-focus place. Fast service times too! 

The food left a lot to be desired, though. I ordered the carnitas burrito. Carnitas directly translates into "little meats", but my burrito was stuffed with pork more akin to stew chunks. In addition, the meat was sorely bland. It was certainly no carnitas. 

My burrito was topped with "blood orange habanero sauce". It looked a bit more like baby food - pur√©ed butternut squash. The texture and taste was pretty close to pur√©ed butternut squash as well...with a hint of citrus and a tiny bit of heat. I mean, it was tasty - really. It was good, but I envisioned a sweet Citrus sauce with the warming burn that habanero lovingly gives...not ultra-mild squash. 

$15 for two street tacos is also a bit of a reach, but that's vegas I guess. 

3/5 because the food is just *okay*.

Had dinner last night, food and drink was great and all the staff were so nice and helpful. They seemed to all enjoy working together. Great atmosphere, beautifully decorated, would definitely recommend for a casual yet nice dinner for any couple, friends or a group!

Wow! Was invited to lunch there last Saturday and it was awesome.. The owner greeted us at the door and showed us around.Great Atmosphere and you  can actually watch  them make your food. The Murals were breathtaking and the staff was incrediably Friendly!  Our Food Server was Talia and she was AMAZING! This is a place to put on your bucket list!
 Great Service and Awesome Food!
ASK FOR TALIA!!!
We'll be back!

Had lunch here and am only mildly impressed. I got 2 cheese enchiladas with rice and beans and veggies. The food was very good, but the teeniest portions. Enchiladas were made with corn street taco sized tortillas! I'd say 1/3 cup rice, 1/3 cup beans, 1tbsp guacamole. For $14. Not worth it at all. 
My entire party usually only comes here to drink so maybe that's what this place is really for. I won't be returning.

Food was pretty good. Portions could be larger. I had two baja halibut taco plate with a small scoop of rice and beans and some grilled fresh veggies. $15. Free guacamole for checking in on yelp was very good. Salsa is great. I would go back but may do happy hour to get a better value.

We really enjoyed our meal. Tony our server was fabulous. We had halibut tacos and octopus tacos. Huge amount of halibut. Very generous potion of octopus. Served with rice and beans and a third side. The sides of potatoes and sides of a tamale were right on points. Decent prices. Lots of outside seating. Nice spot. Glad we tried it.
Great atmosphere, food, and service!  The octopus tacos were great along with all their salsas.

Bandito had a few flaws, but the excellent ambiance, food, and happy hour warrants them four stars. 

My boyfriend and I came in on a Sunday for happy hour. They seated us at a two person table which was fine, but the restaurant wasn't very busy and the table got pretty full after ordering 3-4 starters, chips, salsa, drinks, and the candle on the table. It took a little while for our server to greet us and she didn't mention happy hour until we did, but after that everything ran smoothly. 

The $5 Bandito margaritas are a great price and strong. We got a free guacamole for checking in on Yelp (apparently there's a specific "Yelp guacamole". It looks small but tasted great and lasted surprisingly long. For starters we shared the ceviche, sopes sampler, and chicken tinga flautas. All starters are 1/2 off during appetizers so another steal. The sopes and the flautas were amazing, especially the flautas. They're like mini quesadillas wrapped up like egg rolls and stuffed with cheesy chicken. They serve it with a red enchilada sauce and another sauce I couldn't identify but both were really good. 

The only dish I didn't care for much was the ceviche. I bit into what felt like glass, and while examining it the host came over and told me it was probably salt and took it away. The did have some big black pieces of salt on the dish, but the pieces I bit into were clear and had black markings on it so I don't know. I didn't want to eat any more of the ceviche just in case but I didn't care for it much to start with. It seemed overly fragrant, almost floral. 

Overall Bandito is a solid solid spot for Happy Hour any day of the week. I will most definitely come back despite the few hiccups we experienced because it makes me feel fancy and the food and drinks were delicious.

First time at this place. The restaurant itself is nicely decorated and clean. I went for happy hour and the food was mediocre. The service was mediocre as well, it was not extremely busy but I had to hunt my waiter down and remind him of water and refills. Glad I got to try something new though.

The service here was exceptionally friendly!  The dining room decor was fun and pleasing! The food was delicious and well presented. Happy hour here offers half-price appetizers and some specials on beverages. Great place for date nigh, or to meet a friend for dinner.

Delicious food with a fresh take on Latin cuisine. The size portions are more like tapas. I ordered the tacos which come with 2 for about $15. The tacos are the size of like street tacos. You get rice, beans, and an additional side. The side item portions were small as well. Luckily, I wasn't starving, if I was I might take away a star. But all was delicious nonetheless.

Was recommended by my LYFT driver as she bartended there as well. Food was just okay. Nothing special for $18-20 entrees. Desserts are bleh. Corn was super good. Guacamole was not good.  Happy hour might be better for cheaper prices.

Excellent food and outstanding customer service. The waiter brought us chips and salsas. I'm from California and don't normally get impressed with salsa but this place was an exception. Carlos V. Was our waiter and had to be the most polite waiter I've ever experienced.
Great spot for some delicious Mexican food. I highly recommend the grilled octopus tacos! Service was also excellent on our visit. Would definitely consider revisiting when back in the area.
Very fresh contemporary Mexican food. Hands down the best queso fundito I've ever had. I wish I could remember our server's name. He treated us like we were in a 5 star white glove restaurant.

Came with a group of 18 for Happy Hour, they were very accommodating every time I called re: the reservation and when we arrived, flexible on seating and attentive on service.
Brought chips and two salsas to every 4 persons.
Enrique was our server and he took excellent care of us, drinks were delicious and HH food was a good selection, nicely sized and yummy.
Had the Fried Octopus and it was fantastic!
Will definitely return here very soon, easy access and great location too!

Beth and the rest of the staff were awesome! She was extremely accommodating, sweet, and attentive. 

The Chips and Salsa was really tasty and probably the best chips I've had at any Mexican/Latin Restaurant. 

The Bandito Margarita was perfect! 

The Guacomole was perfectly seasoned with tomatos, chia seeds, onions, and tomatoes. 

The shrimp ceviche was a perfect blend of citrus flavor with a touch of salt.

Service was a bit slow even though it was not crowded. Food was very good. Drinks (micheladas) were good but seemed warm, not chilled. 

Overall a good experience
We are very pleased to stop by here.tge service it was amazing and great waiter Suzanne help us and she with the menu,what a food congratulations for the Chef

I had a very solid meal for lunch.  We chose this place as it's conveniently located near the office I work at.  Plenty of room for a big group on a weekday at noon.  Our table ordered a bit of everything and were pleasantly surprised by the presentation of the dishes.  The food looked a little higher end than your typical Mexican restaurant.  The dishes also leaned towards a more healthy alternative rather than the usual beans and rice base of Mexican food.  Personally I had the Chipotle veggie wrap with street corn.  I thought the dish was very good, but could have used a little more spice.  Still, it offered healthy wrap at an affordable business lunch price.  The other standouts at the table appearance-wise were the turkey salad, steak sandwich, and tacos in general.  The salsa and chips are typical and nothing too unique.  The service wasn't the fastest and the dishes came out in groups rather than all together so many of the diners had food for 10 minutes before our last person received their dish (10 people total).  Seemed like they need to get the food preparation and timing down; that will come in time as Bandito did only recently open.  But overall a nice addition to the area.

The ambience is vibrant, the music was a great Latin vibe to get your appetite in gear. We dined here for lunch during the week and were grateful for the Yelp deal of guacamole with warmed chips. We ordered the Agua Fresca, the chicken flautas and carnitas burrito. All tasteful and we'll portioned. Definitely plan to go back for more!
I made a mistake by coming to ,I think, the only mex. rest. that doesn't do Taco Tuesdays! won't happen again,will not be back...

Bandito is a Latin fusion modern restaurant located right off the strip on Flamingo in the Howard Hues center. Classics like tacos and enchiladas grace the menu but items like the habanero shrimp and queso fondito truly make this restaurant stand out. 
With an amazing cocktail list and Instagram worthy decor Bandito is truly a place to gather! 
The Barbacoa and pastor tacos are phenomenal. But like I said, the habanero shrimp is probably my favorite item I've tried. Crispy large shrimp in a orange habanero sauce with roasted veggies and a jalepeno cheese tamale how could you not LOVE this dish! 
The smoking Bandito is favorite cocktail. Smoked tequila with fresh pineapple juice and house made lime agave syrup shaken into a large margarita glass rimmed with black salt and garnished with a pineapple slice and rosemary sprig. What makes this cocktail special? They torch the rosemary! It's not only aesthetically pleasing but dangerously good. Its those kind of details that makes Bandito so special! Service is always on point, this is truly an epic place!

Came in for lunch on father's day sunday, couldn't tell if they were open with hardly any cars parked in the lot. 
We were greeted right away and got a table in the middle. Very nice place with a cool vibe, the bar looked inviting with a great selection of tequila on the back bar.
We ordered the sope sampler and could see the chef carefully putting it together, but overall it wasn't anything special. Carnitas lacked any authentic flavor and the rest was just there with nothing to write home about.
I also tried the agua frescas with watermelon and mint, but it must have just been made because it was still at room temperature. I put some ice in from my water and it helped a bit. Also we were informed that they didn't have octopus for one of our taco orders, so two fish taco plates were the lunch of the afternoon. Again, no flavor in the fish and kind of dry, the corn tortillas were cold and tastes like out of a package. Even places like Cafe Rio can do better. 
In general the flavors were barely making it, no cilantro, no Mexican cheese, no onions...
The place has potential, but kick up the flavors of the food to an authentic Mexican level please.
Terrible food took a hour when they would dead to get Food by then we were full on chips

If your craving authentic , fancy Mexican food this is the place to be. The decor is so pretty love the painting and roses. The staff is so sweet and inviting just lovely people. The food is absolutely incredible. We ordered the seafood ceviche which was incredible with there salsas that you want to take home with you and there tacos are fantastic. You won't be disappointed coming.

The waiter we had was slow. I asked him for the owl mug and he said he would bring it, but never did. The food is ok...but I'm from Texas, and am pretty biased to my Latin food. The atmosphere was pretty, nice hangout, but I wouldn't expect super delicious food.

The restaurant is located off of the strip, but I would definitely return. The restaurant is very open with cool, funky, industrial decor; the service is incredibly friendly, and the food is delicious! We got free chips & guac with a Yelp check-in, hooray!

The food is done well here. I really enjoyed the octopus, al pastor. And barbaccoa tacos. The service is a big miss and I believe with some additional training they will get focused and execute better. I will return as the food is good and I believe that more time training will equal better results on the service end.

This place is an out of the park home run. Perfectly balanced flavors. The heirloom tomato salsa was fantastic. I loved the soup and my tacos were great. I got the watermelon margarita and loved it.
