Centrally located with a gorgeous interior, there was some real talent in design, in the kitchen and the service was perfect. I'll absolutely come back here as long as they keep up on the quality. This place is 100 times better then border grill on the strip. My only suggestion is that they prep the tortillas on a grill longer. This place is new so getting it this dialed in so early is impressive. I cant wait to come back.

Love. This. Place!! 

Customer service here is fabulous. They had a bit of a wait when we came in for lunch, but we had super prompt service from our server (I think his name was Paul?) once we were seated. 

You get complimentary chips and salsa while you wait. Their salsas are fresh and delish. Mom got the fish tacos and loved them. I ordered the Al Pastor enchiladas, one with red sauce and one with the creamed verde sauce - so bomb! Everything has so much flavor.  

I have also been here for drinks before and they are great! They have super bomb micheladas. 

I'll be back for sure and I highly recommend this spot :)

When we first arrived the place was still fairly empty.  We got a few more tables as dinner progressed, but nothing to crazy.  Ordered drinks and they were out of items to make the Sandia Margarita. Server suggested we watermelon with tequila so we tried it. It was ok,but nothing to write home about. Then ordered a few appetizers for the table. Queso - it came with caramelize onions and peppers. Was really looking forward to tasting it, but was very disappointed as it was lacking flavor. I'm hoping they tweak the recipe as it has potential but needs some flavor.  Turkey alb√≥ndigas- these were tasty and would suggest you order. Trio tamales were a good choice in order to get a taste and all three beef, chicken and cheese . They were  ok tasting. A little on the under filled side. The Fried octopus had a a lot of flavor. It was served with fried cauliflower however the dish had more fried cauliflower than octopus.  Chips were ok but the salsa was delicious. Especially the red! 
Had the chicken tinga enchilas with achiote chile and also cream green sauce both were good. The enchiladas were different and it definitely was not the original chicken tinga. Instead it was a large piece of chicken on top of cheese enchiladas. Side were adobada potatoes which were just ok.  Rice which was a little undercooked but good flavored  and frijoles charros were ok .   Overall this dish was good, but could use improvement. 
Friends had carnitas Tacos which were good and the tortilla soup.  Both were good and worthy of ordering again.  Overall it was good food,but they do need somebody tasting dishes before they come out for flavor. The room decor itself was very nice and different and service was actually very good. They have an outside patio. 

It was their first Sunday open so hoping dishes will develop as they get established and look forward to trying this place out again in the near future.

I'm sorry but the food  took an absolutely, ridiculous, amount of time to come out. I gave this place a chance twice just to see if that was a one time thing, but it wasn't. 

Food:
Asada tacos: 2/5
Carnita tacos: 3/5
Beef tacos: 3/5
Chicken tacos: 1/5
Chips and salsa: 4/5

So I really had to sit and think about this review a few days before writing it because I think this place has a lot of potential and with a few tweaks they can become a true go to spot for locals and tourist. I rated it 4 stars but it really would be about a 3.6 so I'll just give the benefit of the doubt and go back once more to see how I feel.

So to start it's located next to Sushi H20 In the Howard Hughes complex closest to flamingo street. It is a very clean restaurant with a nice classy/casual ambiance. It's not overly big but still big enough to host a big party which was what we had . The staff was incredibly nice and accommodating and that really helped me push my rating up. I could see this as a place to get a few drinks before a night out on the strip

Now onto the food- to start they prepare their food a little different which is a interesting concept , when you order a dish like enchiladas instead of the meat being cooked inside they place it on top which is something to get use to, also the presentation of all the food was amazing.I ordered the brick pressed toasted chicken and the best part of it was the mixed vegetables, the chicken was baked with skin and served with the skin and all the other fatty parts which is not my thing so I wouldn't order this again. I got to try the chicken quesadilla which was good the ceviche was so so and my buddy got the fish tacos which looked amazing and he said they tasted like they looked. 

Knowing this place has half off happy hour and the tacos are 50% off I will be back only to try the fish tacos. Even though it's located behind the strip you will be paying strip prices so be prepared .

I really wanted to like this place. The decor and ambiance is great. I made a reservation on a Friday night for a high top table for date night with my husband. I think the food is probably good but we didn't get past the appetizer. To start there was no one at the hostess station when we came in so we had to wait several minutes.  Then when we got to our table we waited almost 10 minutes for our server, who was also apparently a bartender bc he was frequently caught up behind the bar making drinks. Which held him up frequently so the service ended up being horrible. After nearly 45 minutes for a round of drinks and an appetizer we decided to go somewhere else. Too bad because I liked the decor!

Late night dinning. Not packed so services was great and friendly. Food was delicious and drinks were good aswell. Loved the decor and location. Wish they offer abit more food options but other than that we recommend it!

Happy hour just got a whole lot better! 

First thing you'll notice about Bandito is how beautiful it is, the art and decor are so nice, you WANT to sit here and eat. Then get ready to hear some nice music, the atmosphere is set. 
I've been here a few times, if you go alone I recommend sitting at the bar. They've got some top notch bartending going on! 

First things first, the BARBACOA Michelada is the best damn Michelada in Vegas...the spice used to salt the rim and make the chelada are perfect! Not too spicy, but not bland, then some genius decided to put a chunk of barbacoa on top of this. Muchas gracias! 

FOOD:  
Be bold! Get the pulpo fritto (fried octopus)! Its It's fried calamari, definitely marinated in lime which I love, and not over cooked. I then recommend the sopes, I was pleasantly surprised with veggie sopes and obviously the barbacoa one is killer, not too crazy about the sweet pork, reminds me of Cafe Rios a bit. 
Guacamole and queso fundido is average, not that much guacamole or flavor compared to say a Lindo Michoacan or Segundo Sol. 
Tacos here are also decent, I'm gonna say the best meat here is the barbacoa because the flavor and tenderness are so perfected. 

Customer Service: 
The staff here is great, they make sure you have all you need and more. Took my coworkers once and the waitor was friendly and they loved the place because of the service. 

Overall I'm glad Bandito is here in Vegas!

Delicious food, decent portions, beautifully presented and not overpriced; sinfully good margaritas; friendly and attentive staff; great ambiance and tasteful decor is a mix of modern and traditional with attention to details; and terrific happy hour deals. For me, this place sets the bar for the biggest bang for your buck in Vegas. I'll be back for sure.
Great place for good food and a relaxing environment. Staff is excellent and very friendly

I really enjoyed this wonderful dining experience in Las Vegas.  Off the main Strip but still close to all the action.  This Mexican restaurant is fashionable, clean, comfortable, provides excellent friendly service and --- yes the food is great.

I went there with a party of five and everyone ordered something different.  From the appetizers, to the main courses and even recolonizing the birthday of one of our guests, we had a great time.

Parking - right by the entrance door.  Very easy, close and large parking lot.

The guacamole appetizer was very flavorful and was gobbled up pretty fast.  For an entree I had the Barbarcoa which was flavored just right and presented very well.  I highly recommend this location.  You're not rushed, you're treated like a valued customer, actually thanked, and treated to a truly nice environment.

This review is based solely on the food. Service was 5 stars, but we probably got such great service because we were the ONLY people in the restaurant. I ordered the special Cuban Torta, meat was a bit on the skimpy side and flavor was very lacking. No salt or pepper on tables so we had to ask for it. Portion to price ratio is way off, ordered rice with my Torta and after 3-4 spoon fulls rice was done. To sum up this place I'd say it's best for drinks and appetizers.

We went to this place by chance, we were headed somewhere else but couldn't find seating at the bar as we were just stopping for a night cap.
So my husband says, let's stop at that place with the cool outside! 
So we stopped at Banditos got seated at the bar right away ( they are new and it was a tuesday) and had a great night ! Markus, Enrique and Jessica were awesome! I had a  Cadillac Margarita that was amazing ! And my husband had a  couple of classic margaritas that were also great!
Not to mention the owner Kent came over and introduced himself and let us taste a new tequila we didn't try the food this time but we will definitely come back .
The esthetic was beautiful,  modern with a nod at traditional Mexican decor ala dios de Las muertes and I think this may be our new go to happy hour or margarita Monday hang out

Definitely not worth the price.
Limited menu. Above average food.
Great to try to say you did, but I more than likely won't be back.

Ceviche was horrible, lacked flavor entirely. I've made better at home.
Chicken flautas were bomb, and gooey from their special in house cheese blend. Red sauce served with them (and on their tamales) is not that great tasting.
Cheese enchiladas were good!
Carne asada tacos were mediocre. It's almost as if they used real steak as opposed to thinner "carne asada" meat (if that makes sense).
Guacamole was not worth the cost at all. Also lacked flavor, had to mix it with their salsa verse to get something good going.

Checked it out for dinner on a Saturday night. I felt like it was pricier than most reviews let on. Ambience is good, less casual than I expected. Virtually empty, maybe four tables were full at 7pm. The food was just ok...great service. I prob won't come back. Hovering on that 3 stars but I'll go with 4 since I'm not really a Latin/Mexican food fan to begin with. Benefit of the doubt that it's just me.
Great after work spot for a good margarita and appetizers! The drinks are nice and strong and the bartenders offer great service!

This place is awesome!
The service was great and food was amazing.
We are definitely coming back soon! 
I definitely recommend this to anyone

While I'm an advocate for more localized, authentic mexican cuisines, I will say that the gastronomic levels of their gourmet dishes can give El Dorado Cantina a run for their money. 

I'm certainly glad that Howard Hughes picked up a restaurant that isn't a franchise restaurant. 

CHECK IN OFFER/CHIPS & SALSA: Get that check in offer! Because we all know that we love a good guac thrown in the mix of salsa. Chips & salsa re-mix!!!! In all honesty, it's the green salsa that really out shined the guac. If you're a fan of extra citrus and lots and lots of cilantro. Go green!

OCTOPUS TACO: It came with rice and beans + a side, and the got the "elote" type corn. It was soft, tender, and packed with flavor. Of course, if you love that gamey, seafood flavor of an octopus, you'll like this. None of the fixings overpowered the octopus, because the octopus runs the show in this taco. I definitely recommend this if you're looking to be a little adventurous--steering away from the usual al pastors and carne asadas. 

BANDITO HOUSE MICHELADA: Idk if they make their own chili powder for it, but that tajin is LIT! It is a lot spicier. They put two pieces of fried pork short ribs (chicharron style). Take a bite of that chicharron. Then, take a big sip of the Michelada with the Tajin spice and just wait until you feel your taste buds throw a fiesta in your mouth. You're welcome. 

VENUE: It's definitely a good venue take your vendors, clients, or any business lunch/dinner for that matter. It's a great place to have a nice bougie dinner before the turn up with a big party. Date night? You betcha! it's cute, hip, and upscale for sure. The mural is also calls for a good photo opp or a 'gram. 

SERVICE: Service was pretty slow during lunch, but we weren't in much of a rush and it wasn't very busy there either. However, the staff was super attentive with five different people checking in on us-- also with quite the sense of humor. So props to them. 

Definitely worth a try and worth bookmarking for all you hip, out-of-town, foodies.

Enjoyed the grand opening last night immensely! We were indulged with small bites of guacamole, dips and chips, chirizo meatballs, mojitos, sangria's, margaritas, and to many to list. The flavors were delicious, the staff was friendly and fast and wonderful people to enjoy the evening with. Thanks to everyone!

Wow..wow..wow. Enjoying a wonderful meal at Bandito.  From the perfect margarita, warm perfect tortilla chips, "gourmet" guac...my advice ..step away from the slots and catch a ride to Bandito. You will not regret it!!

P.S Chrissy my server was A+. Friendly, fast, available but not intrusive. Look for her (Monday - Friday PM).  Also "shout out"  to great Manager Julian!!!!

Ambiance: The restaurant itself is so cool to look at. The bar and the open kitchen and incredibly welcoming. I love the overall feel when you walk into the place. 

Customer Service: The host upfront was great about seating us 30 minutes before our reservation for happy hour and our waitress was very friendly and responsive to our needs.

Food: This is where we were disappointed. Everything was just meh. We ordered the nachos which were very difficult to eat because of the plate and they way they were stacked. There was next to no cheese and cold beans all over the top. 

We thought it was just a fluke because the chips and salsa were so good. So we tried ordering the fried octopus, but unfortunately, they had already removed it from the menu. We then ordered the turkey meatballs, ceviche and sope sampler. 

The meatballs were okay, they were well seasoned, but everyone at our table just at one and left the rest. The sope sampler was probably the best out of the three, but still nothing that amazing. But the worst was the ceviche, the shrimp was still gray and there was no flavor whatsoever. We actually sent the ceviche back because we didn't want to risk food poisoning. 

Our waitress was so friendly, and she even told us they were still working out some of the kinks on the menu.

Just based off our experiance, I don't think we will be coming back. The food was just overall underwhelming and the enviroment just wasn't dazzling enough to bring us back.

Very cool vibe as you walk in.  Staff is terrific, we asked for a table near TV to watch the game, they put us in the right spot.  Waitress guided us through the menu, answered every question and was not afraid to suggest things.  Margaritas were very tasty.  The guacamole was fresh, could have been a bit spicer for our taste.  Dinner choices were many and all of us were very happy with the taste, preparation and quantity.

Came here for our reception dinner and as soon as we walked in the door we were greeted with our appetizers and drinks. These guys were in their stuff!! Everything we ate was mouth watering good. Highly recommend!!

Their cocktails are amazing ! I highly recommend the Paloma Blanca which is made with Mezcal. It's a must try! I've had their carne asada tacos and their barbacoa tacos. Different from what I am use to but very delicious. Their habanero salsa I also great. They offer friendly customer service. The place itself is beautifully decorated. A nice spot to go on a date! I would just recommend that they improve their achiote rice recipe and their charro beans...they were very bland.

Great ambiance, gives a authentic but modern vibe. First time seeing such a unique and appealing design.
The color coordination of the restaurant blends smoothly but stands out as well. 
The food is great, you can actually taste 'fresh' in all of the items. 
The whole staff of the restaurant is great starting from the manager to host to kitchen crew.
I highly recommend this place to anyone that has seen it while driving by or browsing on Yelp.

It's a must try everyone! Don't miss out!

Was a fun atmosphere and loved the decor. Had a jalape√±o margarita that was really good, and a watermelon margarita that wasn't as good. Service was decent, and food was ok. They had great chips and salsa, which is a must.
They're are an elegant upscale restauranteith great customer service also if you like Birria you should try their michelada de birria

Great spot, not just your traditional Mexican place. Loved the unique combination of flavors on their version of fajitas!  Good happy hour until 6:30, $5 margaritas and 1/2 off appetizers! 
Service was great, Jared gave useful suggestions, nice descriptions, and guided us through the menu.   A little breezy on the patio but will definitely be going back.

The food really wasn't that good. And somehow I ended up with sausage and pineapple on my plate and not pastor and potatoes. The chicken tortilla soup was really different. The margarita was AMAZING. Just the original bandito one. But aside from that I wouldn't really go back.

The first 2 items we ordered were unavailable...not a good way to start. The barbacoa michelada was warm...a michelada should never be warm.  Drinks also came 2 minutes before our food which I didn't like. Definitely would have tried another drink if it came sooner.  

The panache or whatever were small. Almost a lunch portion but at $22 definitely not a lunch portion price.  The carne asada was maybe 4 ounces of steak and although cooked perfectly it wasn't worth the price, neither were the 4 shrimp that came with my friends order.  The vegetables were delicious however.  The habanaro salsa and sauce were tasty but not hot at all.  

I realize the place is new but it still needs a lot of work. I will at least come back once in the next month to order what I originally wanted and see if the service and timing has improved.

The atmosphere is nice and it had potential but for the same price El Dorado kills this place.

The good: Restaurant was big and airy, our waitress was great, happy hour included appetizers for half off. We ordered the queso, ceviche, flautas, sope sampler, a margarita and a lemonade and our bill was $35 - pretty good price. My recommendations: queso and sope sampler. 

The not so good: the ceviche was bland and the flautas were ok. We had our daughter (who is under 1) with us and she was trying to interact with everyone including all the employees and the bartender made a stupid snide comment about her hair and how she needed a haircut. Not cool, dude. Not cool. 

I hope the manager reads this and trains their staff that snide comments need to be kept to themselves and are not needed.

Cute new place. Wasn't busy at all for lunch. I had the sopes sampler and the veggie sope was surprisingly really yummy! Broccoli and cauliflower. Server was really nice, manager touched our table. Also prices are very reasonably. Will come back!

Good food and drinks.  They got my order wrong twice, but I eventually ate what they brought the 2nd time since it  looked good and it was delicious.  Everyone in our large party loved their food.  The mixed drinks and margaritas were delicious!  There was no one else there when we showed up on a Sunday afternoon.  There are great vegetarian options, especially the build your own burrito option.  Their roasted veggies are delicious!  I doubt we will go there again because of the location -- we happened to be in the vicinity already and wanted to eat nearby -- but it was great food!
Really nice ambience and cool decorations. The service was pretty slow, but a great place for some chips and salsa. They're margaritas were excellent too, I recommend the pineapple one!

Awesome place! Great server name Jose C. We love love him. He is very accommodating, good costumer service, and excellent job! We will definitely come back because of him! He deserve to be acknowledged! We came because of the wine tasting event and he's been so good as our server! Kudos to you,Jose!

The service was exceptional. 2 of the girls were vegetarian and they ordered a drink that was garnished with bacon. Once we told them about the food restriction, they made new drinks. They also gave us a free dessert to celebrate a birthday in our group. The food was amazing! Fresh guacamole, I ordered the seafood ceviche and it was amazing. Definitely go here if you ever find yourself in Vegas !
OMG you must eat here. This is my new best place to eat in LV.  Get here early and gorge on 1/2 off apps.
If you eat here. Ask for Jose. He is the best waiter that I have had the pleasure of serving me in a long time. The food was amazing. I strongly recommend the tamales trio.
Jose the second the was amazing!!! Outstanding!!! He never fail to put a smile when he comes and serve us!! Love the service!!!

Bandito's name says Latin kitchen.  It is not a typical Mexican restaurant.  It seems they break the mold with what they do--and they do it well.

I was brought water and iced tea as I was looking over the menu.  I also showed my server, Jared, my Yelp check in offer of a free small guacamole.  He went off to the kitchen and returned with the guacamole shortly.  It is a bit different than the standard guacamole but it's really good.  

I ordered a cup of  chicken tortilla soup and the brick pressed chicken.  Here's where they break the mold again.  The chicken tortilla soup is a tomato based soup with thin strips of chicken breast and topped with tortilla strips.  It is very good.  The skin of the brick pressed chicken is crispy and the dish comes with a variety of vegetables--cauliflower, carrots,  and potatoes and there's a base of chicken thyme jus on which the chicken and vegetables rest.  It's a very light dish and the vegetables are crispy and not cooked to mush.

For dessert, I got the brownie which has a touch of serrano chili.  The round brownie sits atop a round of dulce de leche ice cream and it's topped with whipped cream with a tinge of lime.  This too is very good.

The restaurant is a really pleasant place.  There is patio dining facing Flamingo and now that temperatures are getting cooler, it would be a good place to sit out.

Service was excellent.  My iced tea was always filled, Jared was excellent in explaining questions I had, and it was a very pleasant dinner before the show I had.
Awesome creative drinks ... old school meets new school approach to the food ... great staff
This place is SOOOOO good.  OMG...the Mexican corn!!  Great ambiance and a beautiful restaurant!

Let me just start by saying, in regards to food, we only had chips, guac, and salsa (which were amazing!). A friend and I wound up here merely because we needed to kill time, and it was close to where we were headed. I cannot say enough good things about this place. Yes, it's small, but I absolutely love the decor and vibe of the place. It was an early Tuesday afternoon (of this week) and we sat at the bar. Unfortunately, I saw no name tag, but our receipt said 'Nicole' was who served us; an African American young lady who was an absolute pleasure. Can't wait to bring my fiance here. The chips were warm and fresh, guac was fresh and served with heirloom tomatoes on top, and both salsas (red and green) were amazing. I cannot WAIT to come back and try more than chips and salsa. As a fellow bartender, I was thoroughly impressed by the drink selection, and the fact they actually have 'mixologists' creating and constructing the drinks. Everything is made fresh. Do yourself a favor and check this place out!
Overpriced and low quality food! My margarita had salt all over the glass as well. Went on a Friday night thinking it was going to be packed..not at all. Save your $ and go elsewhere

Stopped in for some Sunday Happy Hour. First of all, the atmosphere is awesome. Interior design is stimulating and unique. It's not one of the other million contrived, corporate stucco boxes like 90% of the places off of the strip. The floor to ceiling glass also makes for a nice view of the strip. 

Service was great. Tony took excellent care of us. Very friendly, knowledgeable and attentive, but knew when to give us some space to relax. Also made a damn fine margarita!

Food was fresh and flavorful. Flautas are a must. Ordered an array of apps for happy hour. All of which were delicious. Chef even stopped by to check up on everything which was a great touch. That's when you know they genuinely care. Will certainly be back soon and highly recommend for locals and tourists alike.

Let's tell  the truth. My food was AMAZING. We were Welcome by Ken the restaurant manager and were 5 People from the industry (3 From the Bellagio) . Ken  (the GM )was very pleasant and we felt very welcome right away. I went for the Vegi Wrap and the side of Potatoes Al Pastor. The vegi wrap has some romanesco in it....and those potatoes....those potatoes........Yumm.... I may go back and sit at the bar and order a side of the fingerlings potatoes Al pastor. The service was excellent and the vibe fabulous. I do not say this because I am in the industry but I had a fabulous time with my friends. I did not see the bill since my friend invite us. Thank you Ken for the great time, you will see me soon .

Bandito is one of the most attractive Latin restaurants in Vegas with a great happy hour. They are A-Ok with me...

Bandito Service:  My first visit was for an early 6 PM dinner, party of 7 please.  I was the first to arrive, and they brought me to the table.  I was brought warm chips and salsa immediately, sweet.  Our server was extremely friendly and was so great with getting our last happy hour drinks and appetizer orders in before 6:30 PM.  Around 7:30 PM, a huge dinner rush came in, and we didn't see our server as much after the entrees were served.  He apologized and mentioned the dinner rush. He was trying his best, but it appears they were short staffed for the Friday dinner rush.

Bandito la comida: The $5 happy hour margaritas were tasty and made well. We hit happy hour and sampled the following appetizers. 
Fried Octopus: Great red Bandito sauce and the octopus was cooked well.  The tamales in the Tamale Trio came out dry for us.  This took away the potential for their flavor, but the Jalapeno cheese was my favorite.  The Bandito Sope Sampler also came out dry and was very salty in taste.  I enjoyed the Chicken Quesadilla and the Turkey Chorizo Albondigas was hands down the best appetizer.  I'm definitely ordering the Albondigas again.  I had the Barbarcoa Tacos and they also came out salty and dry.  If I were to guess, the plates were probably left out under a heating lamp or on the counter too long before being served to us resulting in the unusual dryness of the plates.

Bandito Ambiance:  I LOVE the decor of Bandito, absolutely stunning and a lot of fun.  It's an industrial look with Contemporary Latin decor throughout the restaurant.  Numerous light bulbs hang that create this great look and the dios de los muertos mural is gorgeous.  Your social media fans will love your posts here. =)

I think I might have caught the Bandito crew on an off night and they still did A-OK in my book.  They started off strong and kind of faded in the end.  The 1/2 price Happy Hour and beautiful decor will definitely get me back to try more dishes, but that's another Yelp tale.  Enjoy!

Dion was so friendly.  My real estate agent Freddy highly recommended this place came in for lunch amazing tacos great service great atmosphere highly recommend I will be back


Back again. Great service and amazing food.    It's Monday and it's margarita Monday $5  my server was tashalee.    So nice and sweet 

Quest Bandito was awesome.   The owners are so friendly

This is a wonderful addition to Hughes center restaurant row! I have been here on two occasions for happy and hands down my favorite for a Mexican happy hour ! They have a nice selection of draft beers and house wines available for 5$ but the two margarita selections and sangria are where it's at!!! The sangria is red ( white also available ) all margaritas and sangrias are made to order and made with various selections of fresh fruit and juices and each is really a delight to the palette and strong !! All for 5 bucks!! Next the food , we were served complimentary chips and salsas a red and green and both pack the perfect amount of heat ! 
All the appetizers are half off and there are no bad choices !
The queso fundido is served hot and bubbly and quite frankly the tastiest I've ever eaten 
The chicken flautas were crispy and filled with a delicate and flavorful mix of chicken and cheese 
The ceviche from what I hear is very tasty and a great mix of complimentary seafood 
The tamales each more flavorful than the last 
The SOPE sampler , I could not believe for as small as they were each packed a lot of flavor and my friend agrees that even tho the carnitas and beef Barbacoa were great the veggie one was a surprise and the veggie mix did not leave you wanting !! 
Also while it lasts don't forget to check it for your free guacamole , although small it's packed with flavor and beautiful presentation and FREE with check in !! 
Also I e tried the churro dessert but it was passable a little to doughy or undercooked I could not figure out which
 also the street corn as a side is a wonderful accompaniment , it's creamy and cheesey and bursting with fresh off the Cobb flavor 
All in all my experience here will keep me coming back and be my go to for happy hour!!

Stopped by on our quick Vegas trip. I wish we could have eaten here every night! It was by far the best meal we have had in a long time! I made reservations and there was no wait! Our waitress, and everyone else, was so friendly! Definitely try the enchiladas and watermelon margarita! Yum!

The place is beautiful,  the food was lack luster at best.  The rice was less than appetizing however, I will say the corn was good. They used the  same mole on the enchilada as they did on the rice., not the best choice. 
No offence who de-constructs an enchilada?
The margaritas were small and 15.00 for their version of a Cadillac margarita in a rock glass, seriously? Your not Del Frescos. 
This place was over priced and charging you for the decore not the flavor.  Eat at your own risk! The service was also slow, management needs to improve in flavor and service.
Amazing vibe and decor.  Loved the food and service.  Try the quesadilla me tacos.  So fresh and filling.

Service was fast, the manager came over & asked how we liked the food & service. Food was amazing , we went with the guacamole, chips & salsa. The green sauce was so bomb! Ordered the octopus it was cooked perfectly. Also, the flautas were delicious.

Came in for lunch with three friends on a weekend. The place was extremely s l ow as it is a new restaurant and I understand how building clientele in Vegas so we decided to still give it a try. 

No hostess up front to greet us, we were sat by our server - Talia. Extremely accommodating to our gluten free and pescatarian diet. When speaking with Talia regarding the menu she was fast on her feet to answer all of our questions, she even branched away to confirm a question with her chef. I am not much of a drinker but the drinks and Frescas Talia recommended were delicious, flavor and color profiles were BEAUTIFUL! We spent more time there then we originally planned but the environment and server made this experience worth while. 

We will be back during the week to try happy hour!
Thanks Talia and Banditos kitchen

I would always drive by this place on my way in to work since it was literally around the corner.  We had some of our executives in from Portland and we wanted to take them to dinner and I suggested Bandito since it was close. We were greeted with such warmth from the staff that we knew this was going to be a memorable night. We started the evening with a round of watermelon margaritas (amazing) and some delicious appetizers and their green salsa was the best I ever had. Since I wasn't to familiar with the menu I asked our server (wish I knew here name she was incredible l) what she recommend was their secret menu which I'm not good not to say cuz it's a secret, shhhhh lol. 
 
This place is a must! Kent and partner Dan or Doug or Dennis I can't remember his name but you guys have an amazing place, you'll def be seeing me again.

Service took slightly longer than we would've liked but food was awesome. Reasonably priced plates and drinks. Probably not a family place more like date night or drinks with friends. Bartenders are super friendly but seem a little under trained. Food was really good. My husband and I both got the enchiladas with street corn and creamed salsa verde sauce.
Hit it for a quick solo lunch while traveling on business. Great service.  Good vibe. Simple to understand menu and good food.  I might just come back later in the week!
Great food, margaritas and service!  What more can you ask for?  The chips and salsa were awesome as well as the queso.  Definitely will return for more.

New favorite place! We're always saying we haven't found the great place in a while.....FOUND IT!!
Food and service was amazing! Paul gave us great direction in ordering and we couldn't have been happier!
Thanks for the great hospitality Kent!
Spreading the word!
See you very soon!
Clean, great food , love the style of the restaurant,  the service was great , me and my friend went here for lunch and loved it, also the margarita was on point

The food was just mediocre the service was good. I live in So. Cal so maybe I'm spoiled with so much good Latin and Mexican food. We all tried something different and everyone thought there meal was average. The tamales were good but the mass was dry on the ends.

I heard a lot about this place and I decided to check it out yesterday for taco Tuesday. I usually go to borracha but I wanted to try somewhere different, upon arrival I found the decor to be awesome ! I loved the octopus tacos I enjoyed everything we tried but this tacos stood out and were my favorite! I appreciate the presentation and elegance that Bandito puts into their food. Service was a little slow and somewhat unfriendly and then around 9pm  they began a after party I guess but the DJ was more annoying than anything. It got too loud and the music being played ruined my experience. The place was pretty empty so I don't get the loud DJ music? The men smoking hookah outside bothering every girl that walked by made for an uncomfortable feeling. I wanted to enjoy food and drinks at a restaurant if I want to hear a DJ and be harassed I'll go to a nightclub! I don't get that whole concept. Overall I give the decor a 5 star , food a 4.5 star and service a 3 star. I thought it was a cool place I would have stayed longer and spent more money but the "after party" made me reconsider. I will go back for the food but I'll do it before 9pm.  Kudos to the Chef I hope they stick to being a restaurant with good food and not so much a party place because this is a place that is enjoyable for business types after work.
Amazon and food and service!  Nick was a fantastic server!  Top marks!  Order the braised octopus tacos!  Muito delicioso!

great new mexican restaurant. very non-traditional but excellent food and quality ingredients.
the customer service was also great. 
i went with a group of co-workers/friends so we ordered a lot of different things. 

seafood ceviche 3/5 stars 

mexican street corn (side dish) 5/5 stars 

guacamole 4/5 stars 

queso bandito  5/5 stars 

pulled chicken flautas 4/5 stars 

chicharron & arugula 5/5

enchiladas (chicken and beef) 4/5 

tacos (all of them! lol)
carnitas 5/5
carne asada 4/5
roasted chicken 3/5
al pastor 4/5
baja fish 4/5

brick pressed roasted chicken 5/5

new york strip 4/5

Literally gourmet Mexican food. I'm vegan and they gave me such a great meal while the other guests in the party had shrimp, carne asada, and other items and loved it. Service is friendly  and knowledgeable and the guacamole is first rate. The decor and atmosphere are so cool.

My husband and I recently enjoyed lunch here and we were very impressed with the food, ambiance, and service. 

Since it was a hot day we started with a couple of the Agua Frescas and found them to be very refreshing. The Tamale Trio was our shared starter and that was delicious. The complimentary chips were good. We loved both the red and green salsa that were served with the chips.

I went with Carnitas Tacos as my entr√©e and loved the flavors on the tacos. The orange glaze on the meat added a great flavor. The beans and rice on the side were tasty. For my third side I chose Mexican Street Corn and enjoyed that as well. The tacos were loaded with meat, but sides were on the smaller side. I loved the overall portion of the meal and thought it helped me avoid going overboard. My husband had the Turkey Chorizo Torta and loved it.

When dessert time came around we were told that the only dessert was a brownie. My husband is weird and doesn't eat chocolate in the form of brownie or cake so we had to pass. The waitress returned soon after with an amazing cheesecake made with serrano peppers and topped with a strawberry watermelon salsa. There was a nice caramel drizzle on the plate. It's a dessert that the restaurant is testing to possibly add to the menu. I thought it was so nice of them to bring this out since I love my desserts and was sad to have to decline the brownie option. The cheesecake was amazing too! I really hope to see this become part of the regular dessert menu. The cheesecake had an excellent flavor and the peppers inside added a nice heat that wasn't overwhelming. The fruity salsa really balanced the heat and the caramel was delicious.

Our waitress was attentive and everything we ordered was delivered to the table without a long wait. The manager, I believe his name was Julian, checked in on us several times. He wanted to make sure that everything was great with both food and service. They were both great and I really couldn't think of anything to suggest that could improve our experience!

We'll definitely be back and I hope to see the cheesecake on the menu!

This was a special treat, excellent food, great prices and the staff is wonderful, will certainly go back next time we are in town. The Habanero Shrimp is excellent as well as the Carnitas tacos, with homemade salsa! Restaurant is beautiful and great atmosphere.

What an excellent experience in gastro-opulence and patron-focused service. My friends/ colleagues and I are in town for a review course at The Tuscany and had 45 minutes for lunch.  We stumbled upon this delight and were immediately enchanted by the good vibes, music, and decor of this establishment.  The hostess greeted us heartily and seated us outside upon our request, ensuring that our table was clean.  Our waiter greeted us with ice waters and scrumptious chips and salsa.  We basked in the sun and niches through 2 baskets of the chips and dip to which they asked if we would like a third. Only one (out of three) of us rightfully declined.  

Our food followed soon after, and, unfortunately, one of our orders was incorrect. We didn't have time to re-order so had it removed from the bill. I can say that my order was a bit wrong, but absolutely delicious. I devoured the burrito with veggies and the mole rojo sauce.  The owner can out to apologize for the wrong order, offering by to remake it on the House. That is superb service. No one was upset or looking for a free meal. I offered half my burrito (using mostly pantomiming because my mouth was always full).  But the team at this restaurant saw to ensuring that our experience in their restaurant be excellent. Can't wait to go here again.
Very attentive service. The food is amazing. The decor is beautiful. A must try if you are in vegas. Will most definitely be coming here again.

Came in a few nights ago. Had an incredible experience! Sat at the bar with Ashley and she was so informative and a great bartender. We had a smoking tequila margarita. It was so cool lighting the rosemary on fire. The shrimp dish was really good. Spicy but good. Cannot wait to come back!

I'm very disappointed with this restaurant. I called to make a reservation and when we arrived, there was no table available.  We were seated by the bar, and changed to a table after we ordered the drinks.
Our waitress messed our orders; she forgot to place half of the order, and she brought an appetizer to our table. The food took a long time to arrive. One of our friends had ordered black bean instead of the beans with pork, and her order did not arrive as she had asked.  The waiter stated that she would bring the black beans, but she never did.  At the end, my friend asked to have the black beans to go. 
I read all of the review prior to making the reservation, and I had high expectations for this restaurant. 
The food was very good and the appetizers were a must; however, customer services must be a priority for this restaurant. The waitress seemed to be annoyed with us and barely came to our table.

We came for lunch not knowing or expecting this place to be good. Their margaritas are excellent! Chips and salsa are different than most. I also ordered the carne asada tortas which was good but again not the normal expected tortas that I would normally get from a restaurant. All in all we will be back.

Thank you to our server, Natalie, for the exceptional service and experience on valentine's day for my husband and I. 


The food was unique and I liked the way the food was presented. The ingredients were of good quality as well. 

I recommend the their Sandia margarita. I forgot what beers I had tried but I really enjoyed everything. 

As for food I recommend the tamale sampler for appetizer.

The steak enchiladas were not very good..they were too chewy with not enough salsa..I think they just forgot the ghost pepper(or was it habanero?) salsa we requested because we love spice and we didn't get a hint of it. BUT THE STEAK WAS EXCELLENT!

This place is amazing! Great quality food and wonderful staff.. It's not your normal Latin Cantina. The decor is beautiful and has a nice ambiance especially in the evening. Make sure to try the queso Bandito, smoking Bandito margarita and anything else you can stuff in your belly. Lol, don't forget dessert.... Churros are sure to hit the sweet spot!!

Just had an amazing and delicious lunch at Bandito Las Vegas! This place showed up as "Hot & New" on Yelp, so naturally we decided to check if out! From the beautiful decor and the above and beyond friendly staff to the delicious drinks and food, this place went beyond my expectations! I highly recommend this place if you're in Las Vegas! I definitely will be back the next time I'm in town!!

Special shoutout to Deanna (pretty sure that was her name) for being very gracious, friendly, warming and welcome to myself and my parents when we were there! She definitely made the already spectacular experience that much more wonderful!

This Happy Hour menu is one of my favorites! The staff here are all incredibly friendly and great at their jobs. I continue to come back because of the staff more than anything else (but the food is fantastic too!). If I had to change one thing, I'd ask them too add some more wine to their Happy Hour selections OR a hard cider for those of us who can't drink beer. Otherwise, the house Pinot isn't bad and their chips and salsa never disappoint.
Love love love this place. The food is fresh and delicious. The service is impeccable. Highly recommend. Free parking.

This place epitomizes the very worst of the food industry. It benefits from a good location and nice decor, but things rapidly go downhill from there. A quick glance at the menu items and you immediately know that this is not authentic Mexican but rather a sad attempt at being original and cutting edge but falling miserably short. The drinks were watered down and punchless, the mojito tasted like rancid dishwasher. I mean, come on: "sparkling wine" in a mojito? How about fresh mint muddled with premium limes and topped with good quality syrup and soda instead? Barbacoa broth and soggy, deep fried pork rinds (sadly called chicharrones) in a michelada? Who comes up with this stuff? So we tried draft beer. Can't go wrong with that right? Wrong! Negra Modelo was flat and smelled of dish soap. The keg was either way old, the lines dirty, or the CO2 pressure needed some tinkering. Food wasn't much better. Fish tacos were dry and tasteless. Al Pastor was way over salted and greasy. Tortillas were rubbery and cold. Tortilla chips were thick and tasted greasy, almost waxy - probably due to being fried in the lowest quality, lowest cost fats. Frijoles charros were so salty I felt my blood pressure rising with every bite. Overall, the food simply did not taste fresh and vibrant. It had that cut-rate, cooked in the cheapest vegetable oil by poorly trained, uninspired staff kind of feel and texture. I wish I could say something positive but this kind of slop should not be allowed in the food scene in Vegas. Charging people good money for this is borderline criminal. We have way too many outstanding food options in this town to tolerate this kind of stuff.

This location is stunning. The decor is trendy and service was excellent. Amanda was an excellent server.
All of the dishes came out beautifully. Sadly, the kitchen sent all of the appetizers out with the meal, except for the soup, which came out later. 
Appetizers: 
The chips and salsa were fresh and offered amazing flavors. The queso bandito was excellent. It arrived bubbling and was the highlight of the meal. The tortilla soup lacked the typical chicken broth base, leaving you with a chipotle and corn flavor. The octopus was under spiced and over cooked. It was hard and we didn't eat it. The server noticed and removed it from our bill.
Drinks:
The barbacoa michelada had a nice savory and spicy flavor. The Bandito Margarita was excellent as I love the Cadillac style. The El Guapo was beautiful in presentation, but was super tiny for a $15 drink. 
The meal: ( we both ordered the recommended specials)
I ordered the habenero shrimp and carne asada was beautiful. The grilled vegetables and tamale were excellent. The shrimp were perfectly cooked and nicely spiced. There was a lot of shells still on them which made them difficult to eat. The carne asada was beautiful but tough. I tried slicing it against the grain into tiny pieces but it was super chewy. 
My husband ordered the barbacoa nachos. There was not much cheese or beans which was the most flavorful part of the dish. There was heaps of their version of barbacoa piled high. The barbacoa was more like a Cuban style versus the Mexican traditional flavors. He ended up using the queso dip to dip his chips and left the rest. 
We will give them another try for happy hour, sticking to the queso and shrimp. The drinks and service are worth another visit.

Trendy restaurant serving classic Mexican dishes with a twist, but actually delivers on flavor is how I would describe Bandito. I stopped by for dinner and was able to grab a seat before the real dinner rush came it. Right when you walk in, you will see a little luche libre wrestler by the hostess table. 

The atmosphere here is industrial chic with a warm bright Latin wall mural by the back. The restaurant is upscale enough for a nice outing, but not too good for a pair of casual jeans and flip flops. It was already busy when I went in the evening, but service was prompt. The watermelon mint agua fresca was refreshing. The cup was not as big as I would have liked it, but that's ok. The cup was rimmed with salt which was a first for me for agua fresca. Still tasty. The steak was very flavorful and the elote was an easy favorite. I think the chef did a good job of just seasoning all of the food without salting everything and using chili peppers and herbs to bring out the flavor of the meat, the rice, and even the guacamole. Be sure to try the churro with the dulce de leche ice cream! It's a great way to wrap up a flavorful meal here. Will be back!

Well, I was with a few other people and somehow it was decided that we wanted mexican food. Luckily we ended up here! It was walking distance from where we were staying. I had no idea it would be an awesome unique food experience! 
As we walked up a handsome employee opened the door for us, and I was very impressed. I assumed he was a manager, but he turned out to be our waiter. Oh boy, this man was awesome! He put up with so much from our group. One person didn't like their drink because they were unfamiliar with ginger beer, he was super sweet about that and it wasn't a problem. Then they wanted enchiladas but the sauce choices were tough to decide. Our wonderful waiter brought out decent sized cups of every one of the sauces for all of us to try! Well, that sold the enchiladas for me. I loved the one sauce he recommended so much I just went with everything he said he would order and I was not disappointed. Now the only thing that is a bummer, I do not know his name. But I know one person from our group went out of her way to tell the manager that he deserved a raise and that's the truth. He made our visit memorable and went above and beyond. I was happy I got a separate check so that he could be tipped super well. 
Thanks! I hope to return someday with the hubby!

As good as it gets tex mex rest near the strip. Newly open just with in weeks. So it wasn't super busy. I had the turkey salad and it was very good. We celebrated a graduation and birthday and it easily accomodated our party.

I stopped in to try this new spot on Flamingo and Paradise close to the airport. First of all they were extremely friendly greeted me at the door and said they love locals please have a seat and come back before I even taste the food got an assortment of tasty items in the head drink specials I got a cucumber pineapple drink and their Margarita which is outstanding like salt on the rim. My meal was able bodegas turkey and a loaded nacho chips that were very good. I will be back to try this one of mine that the side of town for good Mexican fresh concept High ceilings great artwork very tasty food very good service.

The food was really good! We ate mainly appetizers. The slopes were hard and the meat was cold. The flautas were very good as everything else such as the guacamole and ceviche. 
The service was TERRIBLE... it took the server 45 min to tell my father that they didn't have the bottle of wine he wanted wasn't available... it took them 45 minutes to bring out some food. And another 20 min to charge the bill..
The waitress honestly had a terrible attitude whenever we asked where our drinks or food were.. 
the food overall 5 out of 10.. the service 3 out of 10
Great quality food and top notch service.  Not a huge amount of choice,  but the taste more than makes up for it. Great margaritas as well! Can't wait to come back!
Been waiting for this Beautiful restaurant to open, finally did tried the food and it was awesome ! And Friendly staff! I'll definitely be coming back!
Glad I found this place!! Great food. Good service. Good came out quick but cooked to perfection. Will definitely eat here again. Highly recommend. Fantastic restaurant

This place is great! Came in here for their happy hour the other day and it was definitely tasty.

First, we arrived at 4pm and their happy hour doesn't start till 4:30, so I was surprised when our waitress said she'd give us the happy hour deals anyway-- Score!

I immediately checked in on Yelp and got some free guacamole-- Double Score!

We ordered a beer and a margarita for $5 each, and started off with our guacamole, some queso, chips and salsa.

The queso is big. Very good, but also very large and heavy. I'd recommend only ordering this if you're looking for a gut-buster and have more than 2 people... this will fill you up.

Sopes- We ordered the appetizer sopes, which had 2 beef, 2 carnitas, and 2 veggies. The veggies were just ok, but the carnitas and beef were outstanding.

Tamales- Almost the same, one beef (huge tamales, cut in half), one carnitas and one cheese. My boyfriend loved them. He said they could have used a little more meat and sauce, but they were great. I ate a little bit of each, but I've never really loved tamales, so my opinion isn't nearly as valuable if you're looking for whether or not they're solid.

The Mexican street style corn- An absolute MUST. You're tastebuds will thank you. The corn isn't nearly as heavy as some of the street corn I've had in the past (loaded with mayo). Their corn almost has a creme fraiche style sauce and is creamy, tasty and I'd take it home to mom and marry it.

This place is solid. I'll definitely be coming back again!

I came here with my family because we kept seeing their ad on instagram and needless to say we are all glad we visited. The ambiance and decor of the restaurant was so cool, the food was delicious, the staff was extremely friendly, AND our waitress was so sweet. I got the Al Pastor tacos and as my side, I chose the Al Pastor potatoes... I'm still thinking about all this food. The dessert we chose, was the cheesecake. I would love to come back again, this restaurant is fairly new and low key, I loved it!!
First time local and was glad I made the trip! Well done! Nick was fantastic and the food and drinks superb!

Love this place great staff, great food! Very organized on top of there service food is amazing plated very well. We are locals and would love to eat here again and recommend it to anyone looking for great food good service and clean restaurant. If your in town get the chance stop by and check it out prices are high but location is prob the reason that's why I didn't give full stars
Meh. Just  meh. In a town like this full of authentic, homemade Mexican food this place has no chance.

Enrique was fantastic to us as first timers!! Guiding us through the wine list and food menu knowledgeably. Beautiful looking feel to the place!! The house made guacamole chef sent to the table, so flavorful!! Love the decor!!
Pricey but worth it. Really strong drinks and the pastor tacos are amazing great service. Was slow when I dined but it was a Monday afternoon
Amazing food & service! This place needs more hype because it's beautiful inside, food is great, waiter was super sweet, & their happy hour is even better. Definitely coming back!

Me Gusta!

I work in Hughes Center and have been pretty stoked to dine at this super posh off strip Latin inspired restaurant!

FOOD:
The Queso Bandito $8 arrived piping hot and amazingly delicious! Highly recommended starter.

Habanero Shrimp $22 When I read Habanero from the menu I was honestly expecting to exhale fire like a dragon but with some reassurance from our very informative server Natalie the Habanero was actually more savory and not spicy at all. (I was totally pleased) The shrimps are big and plentiful, the veggies were perfect and the tamale was flavorful. Moment of silence for the upscale presentation!!
 
Great wine selection (Cabernet) $11.00
La Pinata $11.00 perfectly crafted cocktail!! 

Serrano Brownie $8.00 was lick the plate clean worthy!

FREE GUAC W/ YELP C/I: Most of it slid right off the "plate" and overall wasn't worth the painful wait! 

The Fried Fish Tacos $21 Unsatisfactory dish! For such a bold restaurant I was expecting more flavor and regrettably, it was bland. I was uber excited to try the Mexican street corn and it was a total let-down!! Dry, equally bland and gross! The yelp pictures are deceiving or I wasn't lucky enough last night to get a good batch!

SERVICE: The service started sooo slow & literally took 25 minutes for guacamole. I had to remind my server and so did the nearby table before a gentleman finally delivered it. Another gentleman attempted to clear my queso off the table without even asking! Can you believe that? I gave him the evil eye instead of a piece of my mind. As a result he put it back down quickly!! There was plenty left (uncertain how he missed that). Natalie definitely recovered in the service area on behalf of her co-workers; which made my outdoor dining experience decent. Great restaurant concept but some employees lack confidence like it's their first day. Walking in circles and continually asking what we ordered became annoying after a long work day! 

$88+ tip 
Unsure if I'll return anytime soon and that feeling sucks because they are nearby my office.

MAN I WANTED TO LOVE THIS PLACE but I just didn't. I've driven past it many times and it looked cool from the outside. When we decided to go for dinner there weren't many people inside which is never a good sign. 

Our server was a pro - I'll give him that much. The ambiance is cool, but the food was just "try too hard." Pretentious and snobby. I can make better guacamole in my own kitchen. It was bland and creamy. 

I ordered something that our server said is "our take on fajitas." How about we just skip "your take" and just serve fajitas like they're supposed to be. Cauliflower just isn't meant to be served in fajitas. Small portions leave you walking away hungry. 

The nervous manager that was walking around had a constant look of concern on his face. It's like they know they are trying so hard to be trendy and scared they're missing it. There's a vibe of insecurity within the staff. 

I can go to a humble mom and pop place (Restaurant El Rey) a mile away and enjoy way better Mexican food for a fraction of the price. 

I'm sure some people will think it's avant-garde but I'm going to pass on this one. I'll let the tourists and conference go-ers from Wisconsin enjoy this place.
I love this place and I would go back another round any day and the food is amazing and amazing service and the people out there

Such a great place! My husband and I were able to share a plate of shrimp enchiladas and some guacamole ... we were stuffed! The shrimp ... wow. So fresh and perfectly cooked. We got extra veggies on the side. Listen kids, these weren't your mama's "side of veggies"! They were charred and seasoned to perfection. I guess the only reason I didn't give 5 stars is because the margaritas (he got the house marg and I got one named the "pi√±ata") weren't anything out of the ordinary. BUT THE FOOD THO.
Service is very good I knew it would be great when the salsa and chips came out. The chips are warm, and the salsas are great. The octopus appetizer is a must. We did a combo taco, yummy!

This place was amazing!!! The decor, the staff, and the food! 

I had the carne asada tacos and they were soooo good. The beans and rice were on point and the Mexican street corn was flavorful. The salsas and guacamole were very tasty too! 

The staff though! Jose took such good care of us! He was very friendly and even gave one of our girls a dance lesson! Jose stood out but everyone on staff was so nice and attentive. We had to ask for our drinks to be refilled once at the beginning of the night (because we drank them so fast) and didn't have to ask again for the rest of the night. 

Thank you so much for the warm welcome!

They asked if we wanted tap water or bottle of water. I decided bottle, and thought it was nice to have a choice. But if I was told it was $8 I would have picked tap. That was the biggest bummer. Food was good. My favorite was the street corn. I had the barbacoa taco platter. It was all tasty but it is pricy. Happy hour has select drinks and appetizer half off. I would come again but make sure to come during HH.

A decent meal. The meal started with complimentary chips and salsa. The salsa was fresh and the chips very crisp. 

I ordered the enchiladas al pastor. The pork atop the tortillas was tough. The classic enchilada sauce tasted primarily of tomato paste. The tortillas were nicely soft and slightly chewy. Inside was just cheese, which sort of made them eat like blintzes. 

The charred corn side was smokey, starchy, and properly seasoned. 

The beans and rice were just there. They were OK, but didn't pack any interesting flavor profile. 

Overall, while the service was excellent, I thought the food was just OK.

Just left this new restraunt the food was delicious and the service was great! Everything had a great authentic taste with some flair.  The decor was trendy and comfortable very modern but some traditional feel.  The one thing I would suggest is don't steam heat tortillas.... you have to throw them in the grill to toast em up to get that good flavor! Oh, that barbacoa michelada .... was on point! I love micheladas that's my drink of choice and it was awesome!

Wow in every sense of the word!!! 
Food excellent
Presentation excellent
Ambiance excellent
My favorite part was the lovely interior design, super cool, modern, chic, classic, tasteful and Red 
Try the sope sampler and the barbacoa Michelada and love it all!! The PINATA margarita was amazing! 
Service was on point, we met Ken the owner and he was a true gentleman, you owed it to yourself to get you taste buds dazzle!

The decor at Bandito is stylish modern, open and comfortable. The service is friendly, attentive, quick and responsive. The three rating is based on our server Amanda's performance.

We attended Bandito during a media event and decided to use the opportunity to get a good sampling of foods and drinks.  Bandito is a fusion/modern mexican/Latin restaurant in the vein of Border Grill and Mesa Grill.  

We started off or I should say we should have started with appetizers but most everything came at once (the soup came five minutes latter).  The Queso Bandito was one of the best I've had, quality cheese well prepared, but at most places, traditional and fusion, it would have  come with tortillas.  The fried octopus was one of the worst dishes I've sampled. The octopus was tough, lukewarm, and bland. The chicken tortilla soup had a strange thick chipotle like broth. The soup like most of dishes we sampled was attractively plated but not satisfying in any way.  

The main dishes were not much better, my wife had the habenero shrimp and carne asada and I had the special-barbacoa nachos. The shrimp were well cooked, but the carne asada was tough and chewy. The barbacoa nachos was great looking but very disappointing dish. The chips, cheese, beans, and pico were tasty but barely there. The brisket barbacoa was tough, stringy, and dry and there were mounds of it on the dish. This is the first time I wish a nacho dish came with less meat. The meat reminded me of Cuban ropa vieja, but not nearly as tasty.  Barbacoa in quality traditional and fusion restaurants is braised or slow roasted and grilled-using beef cheeks or ribeye cuts. Barbacoa should be succulent, tasty, and fatty in great naughty way. The Bandito barbacoa was not even close. I had high hopes for Bandito based on the ambiance and attentive service but was greatly disappointed.  On up side the drinks and the queso were excellent so we may be back for happy hour.
Highlight was the tacos and salsa verde. Margaritas also very nice. Enchiladas average. nice to get off the strip and relax in a modern hip environment.
I highly recommend this restaurant. The staff (especially Marco) is friendly and the margaritas are awesome!!! Great looking establishment. I will be back.

Found the new Mexican restaurant that is great, Vegas lacks in this kind of quality in Mexican food.
Great Service good quality food , the octopus was great.
And all was at a reasonable price, I would say it's a three dollar sign restaurant .

Good food, it may not be 100% mexican food but is good. Different good, we order the QUESO FUNDIDO, AGUA FRESCA WATERMELON, SAMPLER SOPES, TORTA STEAK AND TINGA CHICKEN TACOS. There were two salsas with the chips and of curse the green salsa was very good, red to but I go with the green one. Also very nice place clean, the colors the red and the gray and of curse the portraits and the cutest Luchador by the door next to the host stand. I will decently go back.

Just outstanding. 
I am a local, I've been here 3 times so far with 3 different sets of friends, and everyone so far is just really impressed. (Including tonight)
Honestly, I'm a lazy Yelper. There, I said it.
So.....I haven't reviewed before now, because I honestly believed this place would have so many 5 star reviews, that mine wouldn't matter. I was actually shocked to see this place clicking in at a 4.
So I started reading them.
It seems the prevailing sentiment in any of the poorer reviews, is that it wasn't "Mexican" enough. Not to be preachy here, but it's billed as a Latin Kitchen. Is Mexico part Latin America? 
Sure.
Is Columbia? Brazil? Guatemala? Chile? Venezuela? Peru? Cuba? Haiti? (I digress)
Yes to all of the above, and many more.
So if you think it's not Mexican enough, perhaps you should learn a little geography, and maybe just go to a Mexican restaurant.
But if you want SO much more than that, then cast aside the burrito, and take a chance on this place.
You can really tell a LOT of passion went into the melding of flavors, to deliver a menu that they are clearly, (and rightfully so), very proud of.
The staff is extremely knowledgeable about the menu and preparations, and can talk freely  and fluently about any menu item. They are professional, courteous, and attentive, almost bordering on too attentive, which isn't a bad thing.
The drink menu is cutting edge, the Habanero Shrimp is divine, (had that tonight) the Barbacoa is outstanding, I could go on and on. Each of my 3 times here, I've had 3 different dishes, and sampled my guest's choices as well, and never had a b-level menu item.
I could go on, but I think I've made my point. If you want a cheap burrito, go to Roberto's. (Which is also delicious)
If you want a truly next-level culinary experience, with Mexican influence and SOOO much more, give this place a try. I am sold.

Bandito is a cool little hip Latin flare spot right off the strip. Tuesday nights are taco Tuesdays and so they have a special on their tacos that they serve. This place can get really packed really quickly because the space isn't that big and seating is very close together and reserved. They have great Margaritas especially the Frozen kind, my brother said he he enjoyed his Margarita on the Rocks. They also have some really great non-alcoholic drinks that I suggest you try along with their tableside guacamole. During my visit I ordered the carne asada Taco plate with a side of beans and rice and they're street corn not on the cob I have to say this was the best I've tried while living in Vegas so far.  My carne asada tacos weren't dry in the meat still contain a lot of moisture and flavor. I would absolutely say you should try this place especially on Tuesday nights or Saturday nights if you're in town.

LOVING a quick Happy Hour date with my husband here! Chips and salsa-Amazing! Fried Octopus-FANTASTIC! Guacamole-Super fresh with big avocado chunks! Rioja-CHECK! Margarita-Double check (for both the Happy Hour marg and La Pi√±ata El! Service-Beth is attentive, friendly, and offers great advice! 

We'll totally be back when we're in the area. Thanks, guys!
This was my first time coming in and it was a great experience. Fun atmosphere and the decore and artwork were really nice. Service was great and the food was amazing! Definitely coming back again.

Excellent service great food definitely going back everything was so good can't complain first time here chef came to our table to make sure everything was good with our food everything was excellent great taste
This place is sooo cute! Went for happy hour and enjoyed all the food and of course the margaritas! Marcus (bartender) was great! Will definitely be back!

Delicious! From the signature cocktails to the octopus tacos, this place is will make your mouth water. The ambiance and service were wonderful. We will definitely be back and be recommending this place to all our friends. They have a watermelon salad right now that is sooooo awesome.
Food was really good the location inside is a nice change from the typical Mexican restaurants around town. I would visit again.

A new pretty good not your typical American Mexican restaurant...you can taste the quality in the ingredients. Here is what was ordered:

Smoking Bandito - Pretty good flavor from the infusion with the adobada with a smokey, light chili savory taste to the sweet and sour from the lime and tequila.

Guacamole - Real fresh avocados with real good flavor...green salsa was fire with that garlic but the red was so so....

Queso Bandito - who doesn't like queso and chips...fire

Seafood Ceviche - Not the best ceviche i had....tasted and felt more like poke then ceviche

Chicharron & Arugula - One of those salads you can eat everyday and not get tired of it. It was spicy and salty from the pork belly chicharron...one of the highlights of this restaurant

Pulled Chicken Flautas - ehhhh...like my homies say "there are better things on the menu"

Tacos - Tried at least one of each...you can tell the freshness and quality of the ingredients with the Carnitas and Chicken Tinga my favorites....

Brick Pressed Roasted Chicken - the rice that it comes with for some reason was fire...so is the elote corn....chicken is good and is a solid dish.

Carne Asada & Chicken Tinga Enchiladas - Excellent and done well and the rice is fire.

Margartia Cheesecake - similar to a keylime cheesecake...

Overall this is a great addition to the Las Vegas scene and offers an excellent take on Mexican food in a trendy setting
This place was sooooo cute the staff was so nice I loved the Roses decor all over and the food was super good we order the ceviche and tacos amazing very romantic place that's for sure.

Could leave one star if I could. Awful service, food, and manager. 

Heard good things. Place looked decent, cute, trendy. 

Initially from the get go, even the guacamole was awful. Our server brought it out and immediately and knew it just tasted like over ripe, mashed avocados. When she came over to ask out was she already knew we didn't like it because she asked if we thought it was OK or if I needed more spices. Then when our entr√©es came out .... that's when the real disappointment began. So the elite/street corn tasted just like cold, soggy corn and sour cream. My tamales were made of some soft gross dough of some sort (not plantains?) and were served cold and flavorless. I told her to take them back immediately. Our nachos were extremely disappointing and were comparison to 7-Eleven nachos that were cold, barely drizzled with cheese and were cheap in every sense of the word. 

Our quesadillas were fairly decent considering it's pretty hard to mess up cheese and chicken. 

Additionally we asked for our first round of margaritas with a certain type of tequila (Herradura) and it was not clearly the brand we asked for. The next round of that same margarita were served with different drink accessories, for example my friend got a jalape√±o on her same drink I ordered. Why?

Then when the The separate checks were delivered all the orders were put onto the wrong checks, and then when my friend received her check and put cash in for change, our waiter brought out her change with 20% taken out as a tip for herself already with no receipt!!! We called to complain but DAMN this was a terrible dinner. Awful.


We called and spoke to the manager about about my friend being shorted not provide a receipt, he did not care and we brought it up to him that he did not care he hung up on us. We work in the service industry and this is absolutely unacceptable. Beware of this place!!!

Came here for drinks and something small to eat since it was close by. Brand new and only open for 20 days. The interior was nicely decorated and had a very nice ambience. It is a little pricier than other Mexican restaurants and menu items are pretty typical. The tamale plate was ok kinda tasted like store bought tamales you could probably get at Cardenas. The guacamole was good tasted fresh and chunky which is how I like it. The chips and salsa was nothing special. The Chango Wango cocktail was filled with way too much alcohol I didn't even finish it. The barbacoa michelda was interesting. Tasted liked a typical michelda with a saltier taste and it was topped with pieces of barbacoa which was pretty good actually. Probably won't be back here.
This place is awesome!  The food and the service was fantastic.  Ask for Jose' to be your waiter.  He was the best!

This was one of best dining experiences we have ever had. Food and drink were excellent. Everything was fresh and delicious. Prices were great. Service and friendliness also great. If you are dining in Vegas and want to get away from casino hub bub and crowds you will not be disappointed. Can't give enough kudos.
The food was FANTASTIC!  Great selection of happy hour appetizers.  And the service was excellent.  Friendly,  attentive,  knowledgeable,  but not intrusive.  Can't wait to come back!
High end Mexican fushion type of restaurant. They drinks were great and food was good but prices a little too high.
Great food. Ordered the burrito carnitas, and it was excellent. House margarita was delicious. Great service by Diane!

Love!

This place is gorgeous! The design and lighting is awesome. I love the high ceilings, and attention to detail. The views of the strip are great. Such a good location. 

The service from Tony was amazing. We went for happy hour... he went behind the bar and made our margaritas after asking us how we wanted them. The chef came out to check on us and ask us how everything was- which  was all amazing. 

Great prices for happy hour. Margaritas are $5 and all apps are half off. The food was delicious. And perfect. Best tortilla soup I've ever had. 

A great experience all around. Totally want to go back.

Sadly you have to leave at least one star. My friends and I were very excited to try This place out after hearing all the buzz. The ambience is nice and very modern. The staff look as if they're bored and wander around aimlessly which made my group a bit uncomfortable. The food was very lackluster, very bland and honestly not good. When we finally decided to leave one of the servers decided to take her tip from my friends cash and returned her change with no receipt for verification. When the manager was contacted he proceeded to tell my friend that there's nothing he can do. Overall my friends and I understand this is a new restaurant but if you expect for repeat customers or for people to recommend to others they will need to improve in a lot of areas. 0/5 would recommend or return.
Great service the food is amazing the torta al pastor is a great idea, the mural is great piece super cool

A true Mexican food restaurant, if your looking for something beyond fried taco which you'll find at Robertos and the Michoacan restaurants give Bandito a try.  Totally recommend the ceviche which is a mix of shrimp, octopus and a firm white fish and several citrus fruits and passion fruit, great new little twist.  Street style tacos were great tried grilled halibut, carne asada and carnitas all were on point and great tasting.  Definitely try a mixed drink, venture past the Margaritas and try something new.  Both the wife and I tried their house specials and loved them well worth the price.

Amazing on so many levels. The wait staff was so attentive. They were friendly and took care of us really well. We had the chicken plate and the carnitas tacos. Both were great. The chicken was tender with a nice crisp on the outside and the veggies that came with it were to die for. Carnitas were juicy! Yum. 

The vibey ambiance rounded this off to be one good dinner!
We were looking for Mexican near our hotel. This was delicious!  I would come back hear again! The Queso and the Hanenero Blood Orange enchiladas were amazing!!!
Great atmosphere and service.  Tashelee, Marcus and Beth behind the bar are awesome!! Food is fresh and wonderful!!!
Best happy hour.  Octopus was my favorite.  Unbeatable half off on incredible appetizers !  Loved the watermelon margaritas'n

Came here last evening to check out the HH (4:30pm to 6:30pm) with some of the local Yelp/Instagram/foodie friends. Thanks Nikki (aka @misohungry_vegas) for taking the initiative to organize this casual get together. I probably would still be in the dark about this new restaurant on E. Flamingo (between Lawry's The Prime Rib and McCormick & Schmick's Seafood & Steaks), waiting for Yelp to alert me to this hot new restaurant.

The restaurant's high ceiling, the huge murals, the open kitchen design, centrally-accessible well-stocked bar, lots of exterior floor-to-ceiling glass windows with natural lighting for that natural lighting all food bloggers love, yeah, the decor and interior design of the restaurant are amazing. The restaurant signage out front almost felt too subtle, at least during the day time.

Anyway, yesterday was another scorcher just like the preceding EDC weekend, except it was a few degrees warmer in the open oven we called Summer in Las Vegas. So in spite of having the car AC on full blast, I was quickly wilting away on the drive over and was very appreciative of Bandito's demonstration of the marvels of industrial air conditioning, essential to survival in this present state of daily excessive heat warning.

So once we were inside and greeted warmly by the host, who walked us over to our table, our waitress introduced herself and recommended their Bandito Margarita (just $5 during HH), which we both declined. Sorry, not a drinker. But the ones our friends ordered when they arrived shortly looks great in those colorfully sparkly glasses it was served in. They liked it and all opted for a second round.

As far as our food order, we ordered from their HH special (1/2 off appetizers), and the only item we wanted to try but didn't order was the octopus (86 from the menu for the night since the quality did not meet the chef's standard).

Queso Bandito ($4 HH). Pretty cheesy, but we failed at our attempted cheese porn. When it was dropped off at our table, the cheese was really hot making it way too runny, so it thwarted our effort to contribute to the hashtag meltedcheese, hashtag cheeseporn, hashtag cheesepull communities. But the caramelized part on the edges are extra yummy.

Chicken Flautas was a solid hit ($6 HH). The five of us easily K.O. this fried appetizer, the way Samuel Peter KO Jeremy Williams in the second round of their 2004 NABF title match. Poor Flautas.

My personal favorite is the cheesy Chicken Quesadilla ($6 HH). Every Mexican restaurant serves it, but not many does it the way Bandito's does it. And as a public service announcement for all the food bloggers even thinking about getting that perfect melted cheese porn action for their social media account and their followers viewing pleasure, let me just remind you of that popular and over used phrase "No pain, no gain."

Guacamole ($4). You get a sizable mound of it on a small dish. It was good. I would have loved to be able to order this while mindlessly chipping away at it with the complimentary chips and salsas, while watching the 2017 NBA Finals! #Dubnation!!!  But we ordered a lot of food and some came with guacamole too, so surprisingly the guacamole survived all 10 rounds. There was even a tablespoon worth left on the plate, since everyone was too polite to finish it.

Seafood Ceviche ($6 HH). Beautifully presented with the shrimp, baby scallops, white fish forming a small mound topped with its garnishes. It is a simple and refreshing dish to eat in this heat, but the simple plate of seafood makes for a surprisingly challenging subject to photograph. Just imagine if there is a gallery that have all the photos ever taken throughout the entirety of time of just Bandito's Seafood Ceviche, it would be pretty easy to identify who has either the talent or skill of a photographer, and it would be interesting to see how the really good ones frame and shot their picts. Wow, that was totally random :p

Let's see we also ordered a Nacho ($5 HH), with a Carne Asada add-on (extra $4). There was a mix up and we ended up with a Carnitas one as well. The nachos are huge and definitely meant for sharing. But you certainly can order it all for yourself if that's  your thing, in which case I would definitely get the guacamole plus add on a protein and really make it a meal. Needless to say, we failed to slay the nacho dragons.

The group's HH get together was wallet friendly too. The total bill was only $70, that's including 6 Bandito's Margaritas (HH). Perfect for a cheap Tinder date, which I wouldn't know anything about since I refuse to be forced to sign up witching FB (even a fake one just for all the annoying apps on the FB authentication bandwagon).

I shall end this 4 star review here, since there are plenty of TMI inserted in the review already.  Stay hydrated, don't give the excessive heat a chance to score that KO my friends! And watch out for one another. Hashtag TheEnd
Everything was great. The chips and salsa, guac, entrees service the whole nine yards

Overpriced non authentic Mexican food. It's a cute spot. The interior decor is really nice. It's small. I like the music ambiance. There wasn't many people when I went for dinner. Granted it was week day. The drinks were pretty good. But the food... not impressed at all. I had ceviche. Just didn't wow me. Service was just okay.

Went here for a date night, wasn't actually planning on this place but, saw it while we were driving and stopped in. The food was incredible, drinks were unique and the staff was even better. I would recommend this place to anyone! Best Margarita I've ever had, hands down.
